subject: Bitget Trading Club Championship (Phase 25)
text: Bitget Trading Club Championship (Phase 25) Dear Bitget user, The Bitget Trading Club Championship (Phase 25) is now live! Trade popular spot assets and share a 66,900 BGB airdrop pool with your club members. Top individual traders can earn up to 800 BGB. Join Now Promotion period: 2026/01/07 0:00 (UTC+8) - 2026/01/13 23:59:59 (UTC+8) Promotion rules: Activity 1: Surprise Mystery Box promotion Supplies are limited, so don't miss out! Mystery Box supply is limited and available while supplies last. Plan ahead and participate early to avoid missing out on your giveaway chances. Activity 2: Club spot credits challenge Daily credits accumulation: Earn 1 credit whenever your daily spot buy amount reaches a designated tier. You may earn multiple credits by reaching multiple tiers. For example, you can earn 1 credit by making a spot buy of $200 in a single day, 3 credits for $800, 6 credits for $6,400, and so on. There's no cap on the number of credits you can earn daily. Daily buy amount Daily credits earned 200 1 400 2 800 3 1600 4 3200 5 6400 6 12,800 7 25,600 8 51,200 9 102,400 10 ... ... Rewards calculation: My rewards = my credits Ã· total eligible credits Ã— airdrop pool Eligible trades: Spot trades and Convert trades on Bitget. Spot margin trading, small balance conversions, stablecoin transactions, and zero-fee trades are excluded from the total amount. API trading volume is excluded from the promotion. Users who meet the minimum credit requirement will qualify to share 25,500 BGB. The qualifying threshold will be announced one working day after the promotion ends via Bitget's official social media channels. Stay tuned! Activity 3: Spot trading volume leaderboard battle Rules: The user with the highest total spot buy volume during the promotion will receive 800 BGB. The user who ranks 2nd will receive 700 BGB. The total pool is 31, 400 BGB, and rankings, as well as rewards, are as follows. Eligible trades: Only trades involving the designated assets ( BTC, DOGE, BGB, ETH, XRP) are included. Eligible trading types include spot and Convert trading. API trading volume is excluded from the promotion. Ranking Rewards (BGB) 1 800 2 700 3 600 4 500 5 400 6-10 250 11-20 200 21-30 150 31-50 120 51-100 100 101-200 60 201-400 40 401-550 15 Note: Users must use the Join Now button to register for the promotion. Only spot orders placed after registration will be counted. Stablecoin transactions and zero-fee trades are excluded from the calculation. The promotion includes multiple reward pools, and users are eligible to win from different pools. â€œBitget Trading Club Competitionâ€ and â€œCandyBombâ€ cannot be participated in at the same time. Please carefully consider your own situation and choose the activity that best suits you when registering. Club spot credits challenge: Only the buy volume from spot trading and Convert trades on the Bitget platform will be counted. Spot margin trading, small balance conversions, stablecoin transactions, and any zero-fee trades (including all zero-fee purchases) do not count toward the total amount. Spot trading leaderboard battle: Only the trading volume of the specified coins from spot trading and Convert trades will be counted. API trading volumes are excluded from the calculation. Refer to the promotion page to check whether the buy volume or total trading volume is counted. The futures trading volume leaderboard battle calculates the total trading volume of all futures trading pairs, including API trading volume. During the promotion, spot orders are tracked daily from 12:00 AM to 11:59 PM (UTC+8) for credit calculation. Credits are awarded based on the actual order execution date. Rewards will be distributed to eligible accounts within five working days after the promotion ends. Users can check their rewards in their spot accounts. This promotion is exclusive to regular users. Sub-accounts, institutional users, PRO accounts, and market makers are not eligible to participate. This promotion is only open to users in designated regions. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your understanding. All participants must strictly comply with Bitget's terms and conditions. Bitget reserves the right to disqualify any user from participating in the promotion and confiscate their rewards if any fraudulent conduct, illegal activities (such as using multiple accounts to claim rewards), or other violations are found. Bitget will conduct a review of all users and promptly disqualify those who employ any technical means, including but not limited to electronic, robotic, repetitive, or automated methods, for the purpose of automated or repeated participation. Due to legal and regulatory requirements, some users may be unable to sign up for a Bitget account, or access may be temporarily restricted in certain countries or regions. Refer to Bitget's terms and conditions for the latest information. Bitget reserves the right to amend, revise, or cancel this promotion at any time without prior notice, at its sole discretion. Bitget reserves the right to the final interpretation of the promotion. Contact customer service if you have any questions. Disclaimer Cryptocurrencies are subject to high market risk and volatility despite high growth potential. Users should conduct their own research and invest at their own discretion. Bitget shall not be liable for any investment losses. Bitget Team Anti-Phishing Code : Download the Bitget App now Stay updated on the go! Google PlayAPP Store If you no longer wish to receive promotional emails, please unsubscribe . Â© 2018-2026 Bitget.com reserves all rights.

subject: The latest AI news we announced in December
text: The latest AI news we announced in December The Monthly AI Recap Yazan: Google Yazan: Google Sohbete katÄ±lmak iÃ§in LinkedInâ€™deki bu makaleyi okuyun LinkedInâ€˜de oku [URL]~mk31q70r~dq-null-null&eid=flpa7u-mk31q70r-dq&otpToken=MWIwMTFkZTQxNjJhY2JjNWJjMjQwNGVkNDAxOWUwYjc4ZWM4ZDc0MTk4YWY4NzYxNzljNTA4NmU0ZjVhNTRmMWY3ZDRkZmIxNDNiOWNjZDI3MWY4ZTNjMzA1OGM5NjAzYjZmNTZhYTcwZjM3NjY3M2E1OWU1MSwxLDE%3D Want to keep up with all the AI news coming out of Google? We've got you covered. This new monthly digest breaks down the most important updates and insights, all in one place. Hit the subscribe button to follow along! December is usually a time for reflection, and looking ahead. Thatâ€™s one reason why we've been focused on taking frontier intelligence out of the lab and putting it into your hands in ways that actually matter for your day-to-day. Whether itâ€™s the lightning speed of Gemini 3 Flash helping you tackle tasks in seconds, the new video verification tools in the Gemini app or the simple relief of having GenTabs tame your open tabs, these updates share a single goal: making technology adapt to you, not the other way around. And as we push these boundaries, weâ€™re staying grounded in responsibility â€” launching new tools to help you verify AI content so you can explore this new frontier with confidence. We released Gemini 3 Flash, featuring frontier intelligence built for speed. Gemini 3 Flash brings frontier intelligence to virtually every corner of the Google ecosystem, combining the speed of our most advanced models with improved reasoning capabilities to help with everyday tasks, all while keeping costs significantly lower. It's rolling out as the default model in the Gemini app and AI Mode in Search so people everywhere can now experience the incredible reasoning of our frontier model, right in our consumer products. And weâ€™ve scaled this rollout to a global community, including developers building in the API Antigravity, our new agentic development platform, and enterprise customers on Vertex AI.We added new AI verification tools for videos in the Gemini app. Weâ€™re bringing video verification capabilities directly to the Gemini app. People can now upload videos â€” up to 100 MB or 90 seconds â€” and simply ask if the content was generated or edited using Google AI. Gemini uses imperceptible SynthID watermarks to analyze both audio and visual tracks, pinpointing exactly which segments contain AI-generated elements. We added new AI verification tools for videos in the Gemini app. Weâ€™re bringing video verification capabilities directly to the Gemini app. People can now upload videos â€” up to 100 MB or 90 seconds â€” and simply ask if the content was generated or edited using Google AI. Gemini uses imperceptible SynthID watermarks to analyze both audio and visual tracks, pinpointing exactly which segments contain AI-generated elements. We announced a new experiment to improve browsing and manage complex online tasks. Weâ€™ve all felt the friction of juggling dozens of tabs to research a topic or plan a trip. Enter Disco, a new browsing experience from Google Labs designed to tame that complexity. Disco features GenTabs, an experiment that proactively synthesizes your open tabs and chat history to build custom, interactive web applications â€” transforming a scattered browser session into a streamlined tool for getting things done. We upgraded Gemini audio models for powerful voice interactions. The updated Gemini 2.5 Flash Native Audio is built to handle complex workflows and natural dialogue â€” meaning smoother conversations, higher accuracy and better responsiveness to instructions. Itâ€™s available now in AI Studio, Vertex AI, Gemini Live and, for the first time, Search Live. Plus, a new live speech translation beta in the Google Translate app brings live translation in 70+ languages directly to your headphones, preserving original intonation and pacing to unlock truly global communication. We released a new Gemini Deep Research agent. We brought a more powerful Gemini Deep Research to developers through the Interactions API. Developers can now embed advanced research capabilities â€” like navigating complex topics and synthesizing findings â€” directly into their own applications using a Gemini API key from Google AI Studio. Weâ€™ve also open-sourced our new DeepSearchQA benchmark, offering a transparent way to test just how comprehensive and effective research agents can be on web tasks. Plus, we shared how developers are already building mobile-first solutions to address real-world problems, from AI assistants for the visually impaired to tools fostering autonomy for people with cognitive disabilities. We released a new way for shoppers in the U.S. to use our virtual try-on tool. U.S. shoppers now have a more personalized way to find their next favorite outfit with our updated virtual try-on tool. Instead of needing a full-body photo, you can now upload a simple selfie and Nano Banana will generate a realistic, full-body digital version of you. Once youâ€™ve selected your preferred studio-like image and clothing size, you can instantly see how youâ€™d look in billions of products from our Shopping Graph. We expanded Gemini 3 Pro and Nano Banana Pro in Search. We brought our most intelligent model, Gemini 3, to AI Mode in Google Search in nearly 120 countries and territories in English. Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers can visualize complex topics with Gemini 3 Pro by tapping â€œThinking with 3 Proâ€ in the model drop-down in AI Mode. We also brought our generative imagery model, Nano Banana Pro, to AI Mode in more countries in English, starting with Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers. For those in the U.S., we also expanded access to these Pro models (no subscription required), with higher usage limits for Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers. We released the top YouTube trends of 2025 and first-ever personal Recap. YouTube celebrated its 20th birthday by looking back at 2025. MrBeast was the top creator for the sixth year running, while RosÃ© and Bruno Marsâ€™ track "APT." became the fastest KPop video to hit one billion views. To mark the occasion, YouTube is launching its first-ever Recap so you can see a personalized summary of your year. We added new ways for you to personalize, create and share your Google Photos Recap. Google Photos Recap has returned to help you celebrate your favorite moments from 2025, now with more features to make the experience truly yours. Weâ€™ve added new controls that let you hide specific people or photos, ensuring your trip down memory lane is exactly how you want it. Plus, you can now get creative with exclusive templates in CapCut and easily share your finished masterpiece directly to WhatsApp or your favorite social feeds. We released Year in Search 2025. 2025 delivered history-making headlines â€” from the first American Pope to the global obsession with "KPop Demon Hunters" â€” but the quietest revolution happened right at our fingertips. Thanks to AI, this was the year we saw a massive shift toward natural, conversational questions with a surge in queries like â€œHow do Iâ€¦â€ and â€œWhatâ€™s the deal withâ€¦â€ as AI helped technology finally catch up to the way we think. subject: Learn From a $12M Dropshipper
text: Learn From a $12M Dropshipper Meet Elif Alsulu . Elif has generated over $12,000,000 in dropshipping sales by moving fast and capitalizing on trends instead of sticking to one niche. Her strategy is simple: Spot trending products early Launch one-product stores fast Focus on the right season Move on to the next winner This approach has worked across holidays and seasonal trends, from Christmas and Valentineâ€™s Day to summer products. In this free live webinar , Elif will answer questions from beginners and explain how to get started with dropshipping in a simple, easy-to-follow way. ğŸ“… First webinar of 2026 ğŸ’° Free to join ğŸŒ Open worldwide [URL] ğŸ‘‰ Save Your Free Spot â†’ See you there, Christian Team Tradelle Tradelle Ltd, 71-75 Shelton Street, Covent Garden, London, WC2H 9JQ , UK Company number: 14462289 [URL] Unsubscribe

subject: The first real checkpoint of 2026
text: The first real checkpoint of 2026 Edip, January 5th is the first real checkpoint of the year. Not because anything big should be finished yet. But because patterns are already forming. Here is a simple question worth asking today: Did the first few days create progress, or just good intentions? Most people mistake planning for progress. They read. They watch. They save links. It feels productive, but nothing actually moves. Progress comes from reducing friction. That means fewer decisions. Fewer setup steps. Less waiting for the perfect moment. This is why beginners who move fastest usually do one thing differently. They remove complexity early. Instead of building everything from scratch, they start with something that already works. A store that exists. Products that are ready. Fulfillment that does not depend on them figuring it out later. Momentum is built when effort stays low and consistency stays high. If 2026 is meant to be different, this is the week where that decision becomes real. [URL] ğŸ‘‰ Take The First Step Here The year does not wait. But it does reward the people who move early. Best, Christian Team Tradelle Tradelle Ltd, 71-75 Shelton Street, Covent Garden, London, WC2H 9JQ , UK Company number: 14462289 [URL] Unsubscribe

subject: CSS Mario, Squishy Buttons, and Genuary Begins
text: CSS Mario, Squishy Buttons, and Genuary Begins View this issue on CodePen CSS Mario, Squishy Buttons, and Genuary Begins Happy New Year! This week's CodePen community highlights include a trip to Super Mario World with cutting-edge CSS animations from Temani Afif, a stupendously tactile button from Voicu Apostol, and the kickoff of the annual generative coding challenge, Genuary. Plus, Adam Argyle shows us how to fix the "irradiation illusion" with CSS, and Konstantin Denerz uses CSS shape() to pay tribute to the Commodore 64. pen Jelly Squish Button You're gonna need to set aside a little time to squish this thing. Either drag your cursor vertically, or click the "Follow Mouse" checkbox to connect the squish to your mouse movements for this button with jelly inside from Voicu Apostol. pen CSS-only Mario World (with keyboard!) Temani Afif combines animation-timeline, animation-range, and container scroll-state queries for a side-scrolling adventure, Mario style! Chrome only for now. collection #CodePenChallenge: Until Next Year Our collection from the final week of the 2025 CodePen Challenges includes Pens by Matt Cannon, Vanessa Victorino, Chris Bolson, and Alexandre Vacassin. Ready to join the 2026 CodePen Challenge community? The January challenge is on ğŸ’ª pen Text frame border animation rotation A text marquee traces the edges of a blobby photo in this slick CSS & SVG animation from Fernando Cohen. Check out what happens when you hover the photo, and take a gander at Fernando's earlier iteration from 2022, too. link Using CSS to fix the irradiation illusion "Ever noticed how white text on a black background looks thicker than black text on a white background, even though the weights are the same? This post teaches you how to account for this and adjust perceived font weight for dark mode without layout shift, with variable fonts and the GRAD axis." An excellent tutorial with embedded Pens from Adam Argyle. sponsor Go Make Something Awesome! Web Awesome is a massive library of meticulously crafted, standards-based UI components that work in any framework. Built by the team behind Font Awesome. Start for free today, or go Pro for premium components and services at 20% off for a limited time. link Directional CSS with scroll-state(scrolled) Speaking of scroll states, Una Kravets gives us the scoop on the new scrolled value for scroll-state() queries in this tutorial with helpful embedded Pen demos. pen Genuary 2026 Genuary 2026 is happening now! Alexander Korotaev answered day 3's "Fibonacci forever" with this lysergic JavaScript animation. Check out Fractalkitty's take on the same prompt, too. pen SVG Fireworks Loop "A fluid fireworks animation based on a Dribbble shot by Lizzie Hamblin. As a React component, the animation consists of child components for individual fireworks, which makes it easy to configure." From Jon Kantner. pen C64 Logo (CSS Shape() ) Konstantin Denerz uses some very new tech (CSS clip-path: shape()) to pay tribute to some very old tech (the Commodore 64, from 1982). Chrisâ€™ Corner A collection of web design and development news and thoughts from CodePen's own Chris Coyier. Freshly-Fallen CSS First corner of the new year, so, ya know: âœºâ—Ÿ(ï¼¾ âˆ‡ ï¼¾)â—âœº I feel like we should do CSS for this one. Itâ€™s easily my favorite technology thing and basically BFFs with the spirit of CodePen. In brand-spanking-new news (gnu neues?) the whole â€œmasonryâ€ saga is starting to come to a close. The naming is (drumroll please): .container { display: grid-lanes; grid-template-columns: repeat( auto-fill, minmax(250px, 1fr)); gap: 16px; } I like it. Lanes. Like youâ€™re playing a driving video game or something. The WebKit gang has the story, and theyâ€™ve got demos ready. Try out Grid Lanes in Safari Technology Preview 234! All of the demos at webkit.org/demos/grid3 have been updated with the new syntax, including other use cases for Grid Lanes. Iâ€™d credit David DeSandro for the name â€œmasonryâ€, which is certainly a lot more stuck in peopleâ€™s heads. Heâ€™s understandably disappointed in the new name. I canâ€™t get past the idea that a brick wall (the â€œmasonryâ€ connection) doesnâ€™t look like this looks (itâ€™s wrong by 90 degrees). So color me a fan of the new naming. In the â€œI had no idea this was comingâ€ category is text-grow and text-shrink. Iâ€™ve probably used Dave Rupertâ€™s (ancient) fittext more times than I can count in my career. First, viewport units kinda obsoleted it, but that required magic numbers to get just right. Now itâ€™s going toâ€¦ just work? Although I think itâ€™s just a prototype so far. (via Adam) h1 { text-grow: per-line scale; } See the GIF And another entry in the â€œI had no idea this was comingâ€ is scroll-triggered animations. Iâ€™m very aware of scroll-driven animations and find that whole API extremely cool, but this is something else. Normally when you apply an animation it just runs immediately when the page loads, possibly with a manual delay. With the driven animations you can attach it to a timeline based on the scroll progress of an element or the position related to the viewport. With this, you can also have it triggered instead. A trigger is a custom ident like: animation: my-animation 0.5s; animation-trigger: --thing-in-view play-forwards; Then you create that trigger: timeline-trigger-name: --thing-in-view; timeline-trigger-source: view(); Which could be the same or a different element. Cool. I obviously love that there is a bunch of demos in a Collection. I was aware of (newly) customizable selects and Iâ€™ve had my own plays with it, but Brecht De Ruyte is the master. Iâ€™ll link up part 4 of his so-far-five-part series on the matter. This is whatâ€™s happening: See GIF Like: whaaaaat. But I suppose I could have guessed. At one time CSS gave us a :checked selector and HTML has labels-connected-to-inputs and people used those things to build absolutely amazing things. There is much more interactivity on offer in a <select>. You can adjust your email preferences any time, or instantly opt out of emails of this kind. Need help with anything? Hit up support. Interested in sponsoring? Here's our sponsorship info.

subject: 10 Gemini prompts to help you keep your New Yearâ€™s resolutions
text: 10 Gemini prompts to help you keep your New Yearâ€™s resolutions The Monthly AI Recap Yazan: Google Yazan: Google Sohbete katÄ±lmak iÃ§in LinkedInâ€™deki bu makaleyi okuyun LinkedInâ€˜de oku [URL]~mk1f6d2o~g4-null-null&eid=flpa7u-mk1f6d2o-g4&otpToken=MWIwMTFkZTQxNjJhY2JjNWJjMjQwNGVkNDAxOWUxYjc4Y2NkZDQ0MTlhYTY4NjYxNzljNTA4NmU0ZjVhNTRmMWY3ZDRkZmE0MWFjNWNjZGE2M2JmZmJhZTE2ZDNhNmZhOGMzZGQxNDExZTdiZDBhZTc2NjBmYSwxLDE%3D When New Yearâ€™s resolutions donâ€™t work out, a lack of planning is often to blame. This year, Gemini can help you fix that. Using the right prompts, scheduled actions and connected apps, you can quickly create detailed guides and structured learning paths that fit your life. Here are 10 prompts you can adapt to help you stick to your resolutions. As you build momentum, you can adjust the prompts, ask Gemini to add tasks to your calendar to stay organized and even create your own Gems, custom versions of Gemini that remember your goals and act as dedicated experts. That way, youâ€™ll never need to start from scratch. 1. Create a custom workout plan. Give Gemini your starting point and your goal to get a step-by-step schedule that builds over time. Use personalization features to reference past chats for an even more tailored plan. You can even ask it to save specific instructions â€” i.e., Remember I live in NYC and only have access to a treadmill. Prompt: I want to run the New York City marathon in 6 months. I recently finished a half marathon in 2 hours, and I can train 5 days a week. Create a monthly training plan that will help me continue to build my endurance. 2. Declutter your home. Use Gemini to create a structured, daily plan that makes organizational projects feel less overwhelming. Supplement your project using Gemini Live with camera sharing to get real-time feedback. Prompt: I want to organize and declutter my apartment this month. Create a 30-day plan that breaks the process into simple, daily tasks that take no more than 20 minutes each and wonâ€™t require me to purchase any new items. 3. Learn a new language. Tell Gemini your goal and available time, and it will structure a curriculum and generate interactive study tools to keep you motivated and test your progress. Prompt: Iâ€™d like to learn basic French. Generate a 30-day guided learning plan for these topics and create an interactive multiple-choice quiz on the verb conjugations. Please also generate a set of flashcards for the 50 phrases. 4. Advance your career. Use Gemini to refine your interview skills, analyze a presentation video and generate a professional headshot. Bonus step: Upload a headshot to Gemini and use Nano Banana to add some professional polish for platforms like LinkedIn. Prompt: I have a job interview next week for [role]. Simulate a live, conversational interview with me, focusing on behavioral questions. Second, create a detailed feedback report after I upload my video rehearsal, analyzing my speaking pace, body language and use of filler words. 5. Eat healthier. Ask Gemini to schedule a weekly meal plan tailored to your specific dietary needs and preferences, eliminating the stress of deciding what to cook. Prompt: I want to eat healthier. Every Sunday at 9 a.m., please create a 7-day, high-protein and vegetarian-friendly dinner plan. I have about 45 minutes to cook each night. Include a grocery list for the week. 6. Create a better budget. By asking Gemini to analyze spending data from connected apps, you can get specific, actionable and personalized budgeting rules to implement weekly. Prompt: Analyze the uploaded Google Sheet containing my monthly spending for the last quarter and identify 3 areas of non-essential spending. Suggest practical weekly budgeting rules I can immediately implement to save 15%. 7. Create a custom reading list. Combine expert recs with a manageable pace, keeping you from getting overwhelmed by a backlog of books. Use recurring actions to get a fresh set of recommendations every month. Prompt: I want to read 12 business books in 2026. Schedule a recurring action for the first of every month: Suggest a list of 5 non-fiction titles related to advertising and create a sample monthly reading and review schedule. 8. Replace a bad habit with a good one. ID the triggers for your bad habits and find concrete replacements. Prompt: I want to reduce my phone screen time by 2 hours a week. Outline a 'Habit Replacement Plan' that identifies my typical trigger times and suggests a positive alternative activity for each. 9. Overcome the blank page. Use this prompt to get low-friction creative ideas that help you defeat "blank page" syndrome and keep your new creative habit going. Prompt: Give me 7 unique, one-sentence journaling prompts for the week that encourage reflection on my goals and progress. 10. Plan for long-term success. This future-facing prompt encourages you to think long-term, helping you scale up successful habits and make your resolution a permanent lifestyle change. Prompt: It's July 1st. I've successfully maintained my resolution to [resolution name] for 6 months. Create a 3-part maintenance plan to help me make this a permanent habit and set a bigger goal for the rest of 2026. A good plan can be the difference between a goal and a long-term habit. This year, instead of starting with a vague idea, give Gemini the details to build a roadmap you can actually follow. subject: Bitget TradFi Goes Live To Public: Trade gold, forex and more all from one app
text: Bitget TradFi Goes Live To Public: Trade gold, forex and more all from one app Dear Bitget user, We're excited to share that after half a month of limited access, Bitget TradFi is now officially live and available to all users! Bitget first announced its transformation into the world's first Universal Exchange (UEX) in September 2025, actualising our commitment to always putting users first and to continuously prioritise delivering results. The launch of Bitget TradFi cements Bitget's step into the direction of building the world's first UEX, demonstrating Bitget's ability to adapt and develop according to volatile markets and users' everchanging needs. With Bitget TradFi, users now have the option of trading traditional assets in addition to crypto, all via one singular app. Join Now What is Bitget TradFi? Bitget TradFi is Bitget's newest product that allows users to trade major traditional assets, namelyâ€” forex, metals, indexes and commodities directly with USDT. At launch, Bitget offers a total of 79 trading instruments across these four asset classes. Crypto-tradfi diversification reduces overall risk exposure, thus yielding superior risk-adjusted profits. Advantages of Bitget TradFi Deep Liquidity and Low Slippage: Bitget boasts deep order books and transparent maker/taker fees with no hidden costs. Trade traditional assets like gold, forex, indexes and commodities directly with USDT. Supports u p to 500x to suit different risk preferences. One App, all assets: Easily diversify your portfolio all within one App. For the full details of Bitget TradFi product and FAQ, visit this article here. Watch this space as we gradually roll out more Bitget TradFi products on the platform, including more trading pairs across diverse instruments like forex, indices, precious metals, commodities, and other categories. Start trading TradFi now! Download and sign up Users can trade directly using the Bitget TradFi app. Ensure the app is updated to the latest version for the improved experience (Android: 2.72.0; iOS: 2.72.0). Refer to the Bitget TradFi (MT5) beginner's guide for more details. Risk warning: Trading derivatives carries a high level of risk and may result in the loss of your invested capital due to market volatility. Please carefully assess your risk tolerance and trade responsibly. Your investments are at your sole discretion. You are solely responsible and liable for the potential risks associated with your transactions. Bitget assumes no responsibility. Bitget Team Anti-Phishing Code : Download the Bitget App now Stay updated on the go! Google PlayAPP Store If you no longer wish to receive promotional emails, please unsubscribe . Â© 2018-2026 Bitget.com reserves all rights.

subject: Do not make this mistake
text: Do not make this mistake Edip, January 3rd is a dangerous day. The excitement of January 1st fades. The motivation of â€œnew year, new startâ€ gets quiet. And this is exactly when most people slip back into old habits. Not because they are lazy. But because they never locked in momentum. Here is the uncomfortable truth: If nothing is in motion by day 3, the year often looks exactly like the last one. Momentum needs something concrete. Something real. Something that exists even when motivation drops. This is why starting with a ready made store matters so much right now. It turns intention into action before doubt shows up. subject: â° Last chance to win a lifetime of Proton by Jan 5
text: â° Last chance to win a lifetime of Proton by Jan 5 Join our annual fundraiser to support the nonprofits you chose, and have a chance to win a rare Proton Lifetime account. [Proton]([URL] Join our charity fundraiser before it ends on January 5th [Proton Lifetime Fundraiser 8th Edition now open, infinity symbol on dark background.] Dear Proton community member, A quick reminder that time is running out to join our annual charity fundraiser. By entering the raffle for as little as $10, you are directly supporting ten community-nominated organizations that protect privacy, fight censorship, and defend freedom of speech around the world. [You can learn all the details here]([URL] â€” including the organizations we're supporting and the perks of the Lifetime plan. And of course, youâ€™ll have a chance to win our most valuable plan: a Proton Lifetime Account, valued at over $14,000. Each $10 ticket gives you a chance to win one of 10 rare Lifetime Plans, offering you privacy for life, with no renewals ever. Tickets are available until January 5 at 11:59 PM CET | 5:59 PM EST and can be purchased using a bank card, Apple Pay, Google Pay, PayPal, or crypto via BitPay from the Proton supporter shop. Winning tickets will be announced the following day. [Join the Lifetime fundraiser]([URL] Your support makes a difference Together, weâ€™ve donated [over $4 million]([URL] to organizations working to build a better internet. This yearâ€™s fundraiser is especially important, as many of these organizations have recently experienced reduced funding. Thank you for helping make this charity fundraiser possible year after year. From everyone at Proton, we wish you a Happy New Year. subject: NEWSLETTER #16
text: NEWSLETTER #16 Aselsan - Newsletter Yazan: Aselsan Yazan: Aselsan Sohbete katÄ±lmak iÃ§in LinkedInâ€™deki bu makaleyi okuyun LinkedInâ€˜de oku [URL]~mjwtcq37~ui-null-null&eid=flpa7u-mjwtcq37-ui&otpToken=MWIwMTFkZTQxNjJhY2JjNWJjMjQwNGVkNDAxOWU0YjE4YmM2ZDE0MjkxYWQ4YTYxNzljNTA4NmU0ZjVhNTRmMWY3ZDRkZjkxNzdjY2UyZDMwMDhlZjE5NzNkY2M4Yjg1M2I4NTYyNTNhYzFjNmMzYmUyMGIzYywxLDE%3D ASELSAN wins landmark electronic warfare contract in Poland ASELSAN has achieved a major strategic breakthrough by winning a USD 410 million electronic warfare export contract with Poland, one of NATOâ€™s key members and home to one of the Allianceâ€™s largest armed forces. Awarded through a highly competitive international tender, the contract marks a significant milestone for ASELSAN and TÃ¼rkiye, confirming the companyâ€™s ability to deliver cutting-edge electronic warfare capabilities to top-tier NATO customers. Read more: Click here ASELSAN deepens defense cooperation in the Asia-Pacific ASELSAN continues to strengthen its footprint in the Asia-Pacific region through two significant developments in Malaysia and Indonesia. A new teaming agreement in Malaysia and the successful integration and live-fire testing of advanced systems in Indonesia highlight ASELSANâ€™s growing role as a trusted defense technology partner, supporting regional maritime security and land force modernization. Read more: Click here Stronger regional presence at EDEX 2025 ASELSAN participated in EDEX 2025 in Cairo from December 1â€“4, showcasing its advanced defense technologies. The portfolio covered air, land, and naval systems, including communications, radar, electronic warfare, air defense, and platform modernization solutions. Read more: Click here TOLUN family expands with new members ASELSANâ€™s TOLUN smart munition family has reached a new level of operational maturity through a series of successful live-fire tests conducted on both unmanned and manned platforms. The campaign validated multiple TOLUN variants, including fragmentation, concrete-penetrating, and imaging infrared guided configurations, confirming precision engagement against stationary and moving targets across diverse mission profiles. Read more: Click here KGK 84 completes first live-fire test ASELSAN successfully completed the first live-fire test of its KGK 84 munition, marking an important milestone in the development of indigenous precision strike capabilities. The test demonstrated the systemâ€™s operational readiness and validated its performance under realistic mission conditions. Read more: Click here Direct hit from HÄ°SAR A in acceptance firing The acceptance firing of HÄ°SAR A air defense system, within Steel Dome layered air defense architecture, was successfully conducted in December using products rolling off the serial production line. Read more: Click here Key sensor technologies complete flight tests ASELFLIR 600 completed a full-performance flight on AKINCI platform, marking an important milestone in its development and qualification process, while KARAT Infrared Search and Track System successfully performed its first flight on KIZILELMA. Read more: Click here TB3-controlled ALBATROS-S executes simulated maritime strike ASELSANâ€™s ALBATROS-S Unmanned Surface Vehicle (USV) successfully executed a simulated attack against a maritime target after being controlled via a BAYKAR TB3 UAV launched from TCG ANADOLU, marking a major milestone in joint unmanned maritimeâ€“air operations. Read more: Click here ASELSAN launches LUNA-1 low orbit IoT satellite ASELSAN has successfully launched LUNA-1, the first satellite of its space-based IoT solution family, aboard a SpaceX Falcon-9 rocket under the Transporter-15 mission from California. After separating from the launch vehicle, LUNA-1 was deployed into a 510 km sun-synchronous low-Earth orbit, and its first telemetry signals were received and decoded by ASELSANâ€™s ground station in Ankara, confirming that the satellite is operating nominally. Read more: Click here ASELSAN ranks 47th on the SIPRI top 100 list ASELSAN climbed from 53rd to 47th place on the Stockholm International Peace Research Instituteâ€™s (SIPRI) Top 100 Arms-Producing and Military Services Companies list compared to the previous year, signaling a meaningful shift in the global defense industrial landscape. subject: Edip Mangtay , Join Your First Contest and Win 200 LeetCoins!
text: Edip Mangtay , Join Your First Contest and Win 200 LeetCoins! Join Your First Contest! Saturday, January 3 ï»¿ï»¿Don't think you're ready for interviews yet? Contests are the best way to gauge how well-prepared you are and to simulate the environment of a real interview. By participating in contests, you will see weekly improvements in your progress and you will know how ready you are for the real deal. We are hiring! Apply now for the opportunity to join LeetCode's content team as a problem adder or solution author. You can find more details and the application by seeing our announcement post and apply now! ï»¿ï»¿After each contest, you can learn from the best by reading our official solutions and browsing the top-voted solutions in Discuss. As a special bonus, you will receive 200 LeetCoins for your first contest submission! Weekly Contest 483 starts at 06:30 PM PST Saturday (10:30 AM Beijing Time Sunday), and Biweekly Contest 173 starts at 06:30 AM PST Saturday (10:30 PM Beijing Time Saturday). You will have 1.5 hours to solve a few interesting interview problems. If you participate in both contests, you will receive an additional bonus of 35 LeetCoins! In addition to the bonus for first time participants, the Top 200 coders win prizes: â€¢ 1st place wins 5000 LeetCoins.â€¢ 2nd place wins 2500 LeetCoins.â€¢ 3rd place wins 1000 LeetCoins.â€¢ 4th - 50th place win 300 LeetCoins.â€¢ 51st - 100th place win 100 LeetCoins.â€¢ 101st - 200th place win 50 LeetCoins.â€¢ Solve at least one problem to win 5 LeetCoins.â€¢ Participate in both contests to win 35 LeetCoins. See you on the scoreboard and good luck! Join now! Sincerely, The LeetCode Team Copyright Â© 2026 LeetCode, All rights reserved.Unsubscribe from this type of email.

text: 5 trends you should watch for in 2026 AI in Action Yazan: IBM Yazan: IBM Sohbete katÄ±lmak iÃ§in LinkedInâ€™deki bu makaleyi okuyun LinkedInâ€˜de oku [URL]~mjubejgg~6b-null-null&eid=flpa7u-mjubejgg-6b&otpToken=MWIwMTFkZTQxNjJhY2JjNWJjMjQwNGVkNDAxOWU1YjQ4Y2M4ZDg0OTkxYTg4YjYxNzljNTA4NmU0ZjVhNTRmMWY3ZDRkZmE1NWFkM2JjZTE2YzgzZGJiMDdkZTBlZjE3MGE3YmQ0OWQzYjc3NGZiNjAyM2UxZCwxLDE%3D In a world moving at the speed of AIâ€”and soon, quantumâ€”stability is no longer the goal. The most forward-thinking leaders arenâ€™t searching for solid ground; theyâ€™re looking for the cracks where new opportunities will emerge. Our latest research highlights five data-driven trends that will define business leadership in 2026. Check them out below â¤µ 1ï¸âƒ£ Uncertainty will be your greatest assetâ€”if you embrace it In a volatile environment, rapid response is non-negotiable. In fact, 90% of executives say theyâ€™ll lose their edge if their organization canâ€™t operate in real time. What to do â†’ Rewire the organization for rapid response. 2ï¸âƒ£ Employees will want more AIâ€”not less Thereâ€™s a perception gap at the heart of AI transformation. It's not just about automationâ€”itâ€™s about unlocking human potential. 61% of employees say AI makes their job less mundane and more strategic. Across all age groups, workers are increasingly open to deeper AI integration by their employers. What to do â†’ Create a roadmap for roles that donâ€™t yet exist. ğŸ‘‰ How will age groups respond to AI adoption in 2026? See the breakdown â¤µ 3ï¸âƒ£ Customers will hold your AI accountable Customer trust is the ultimate currency: 95% of executives say consumer trust in their AI will define the success of new products and services. Not influenceâ€”define. What to do â†’ Make customers lab partners, not lab rats. Two-thirds of consumers would switch brands if a company intentionally concealed AIâ€™s involvement in their experience. 4ï¸âƒ£ Global AI resilience will require a local safety net AI resilience hinges on uninterrupted access. That means AI sovereigntyâ€”an organizationâ€™s ability to control and govern its AI systems, data, and infrastructure at all timesâ€”has become mission-critical. What to do â†’ Solidify your AI safeguards. 5ï¸âƒ£ Quantum advantage will demand strength in numbers Quantum computing has moved well-beyond wishful thinking: Recent research indicates that quantum advantage is likely to emerge by the end of 2026. What to do â†’ Prepare for the next big breakthrough. Looking Ahead In 2026, the secret to capturing fleeting opportunities wonâ€™t be perfect planningâ€”it will be developing an appetite for ambiguity. text: Thank You for Learning with Us in 2025 ğŸ¤ Hereâ€™s to Learning in 2026 View this post on the web at [URL] â€œPerhaps the worst sin in life is knowing right and not doing it.â€ â€• Martin Luther King Jr. For people who use the Glasp & YouTube Summary extension Weâ€™ve received feedback that the Glaspâ€™s YouTube Summary [ [URL] ] currently experiencing issues retrieving transcripts for some users. We sincerely apologize for the problem preventing YouTube transcripts from being fetched. Weâ€™re actively investigating the issue and working on a fix. Please bear with us until the updated version is released. â³ In the meantime If you have an audio file, you can upload it to Glasp to generate a transcript. Please visit this guide [ [URL] ]. You can also contact us with links to the YouTube videos you need transcripts for. We may already have access to them or be able to help. Hi friends, We hand-picked 3 good pieces of content to inspire and motivate you now and in the future. Keep track of the insights that resonate with you by highlighting them with GlaspğŸ’¡ If you want to reread or highlight this newsletter, save it to Glasp. ğŸ“š 3 Good Recommendations 10 ideas for 2026 [ [URL] ] by Shreyas Doshi (2 mins) Shreyas Doshi argues that lasting success comes not from copying tactics or frameworks but from cultivating deep understanding of how people think. He highlights how ego-driven behaviors â€” like wanting to feel smart or assuming others understand us â€” often sabotage sound judgment and progress. Ideal for: Product leaders, founders, and professionals seeking to improve decision-making, critical thinking, and self-awareness in their work and career. Why Itâ€™s Worth Your Time: The essay distills powerful psychological and cognitive insights into concise reflections that challenge common thinking traps and inspire personal and professional growth. The Era of Summarized Living, What Great Products Flex, & Mainstream Signs of AR [ [URL] ] by Scott Belsky (11 mins) Summary: The post explores three key themes: the rise of â€œSummarized Livingâ€ through AI tools that record and analyze daily interactions; how great products succeed by enabling users to subtly â€œflexâ€ creativity, skills, wit, or status; and the approaching mainstream moment of augmented reality (AR) as it begins to shape new social behaviors and connections. Ideal for: Founders, product designers, investors, and technologists interested in the intersection of AI, human behavior, and the future of digital experiences. Why Itâ€™s Worth Your Time: The analysis offers deep foresight into how summarization, flex-driven design, and AR will redefine memory, identity, and interaction â€” equipping builders and thinkers to anticipate the next major shifts in product design and human-computer connection. subject: One decision before 2026 starts
text: One decision before 2026 starts Edip, 2025 is almost over. And here is the honest part most people avoid thinking about: A year passes whether you act or not. Some people used 2025 to learn. Some to test. Some to start. Others stayed in the same place. Not because they failed. But because they never truly began. As 2026 approaches, there is one powerful question worth asking: Will next year look different because of one clear decision you make now? Not a big plan. Not a perfect strategy. Just a real start. Momentum does not come from January motivation. It comes from having something in motion before motivation fades. That is why so many people choose to start now instead of waiting for the calendar to change. A ready made Tradelle store exists for exactly this moment: When you want next year to be about progress, not preparation. âœ… A complete store âœ… 20 Proven products âœ… Order f ulfillment can be handled automatically âœ… Ready within 24 hours âœ… 30â€‘day moneyâ€‘back guarantee [URL] ğŸ‘‰ Start 2026 With Momentum You do not need a new year to start. subject: The .NET Insider â€“ Issue 16
text: The .NET Insider â€“ Issue 16 The .NET Insider Yazan: .NET Developers Yazan: .NET Developers Sohbete katÄ±lmak iÃ§in LinkedInâ€™deki bu makaleyi okuyun LinkedInâ€˜de oku [URL]~mjrm7bpg~ra-null-null&eid=flpa7u-mjrm7bpg-ra&otpToken=MWIwMTFkZTQxNjJhY2JjNWJjMjQwNGVkNDAxOWU3YjA4ZmNhZDg0NDlmYWM4YzYxNzljNTA4NmU0ZjVhNTRmMWY3ZDRkZmJhNjRiM2U0ZTYwM2FjZTM0Nzc1N2Y2MmM2NjQ0NDE5YWUyMDI1NzJlZDcxMjg0YiwxLDE%3D Read Online - [URL] Join ğ—§ğ—µğ—² .ğ—¡ğ—˜ğ—§ ğ—œğ—»ğ˜€ğ—¶ğ—±ğ—²ğ—¿ dotnet.news ğŸ’» Stay updated on all things .NET ğŸ“š Learn tips, tricks, and best practices ğŸŒ Discover tools and libraries to enhance your workflow How to Build a Production-Ready Invoice Builder in .NET Using IronPDF The article explains how to design and implement a robust invoice builder application using modern .NET technologies, with a strong focus on PDF generation quality, reliability, and compliance. â€”By Anton Martyniuk Enterprise Patterns for ASP.NET Core Minimal API: Transaction Script Pattern â€“ The Shortcut That Quietly Reshapes Your System The article explains the Transaction Script pattern in ASP.NET Core Minimal APIs, showing how handling all logic inside a single endpoint can speed up delivery but quietly create technical debt as business rules grow. It highlights when this pattern is useful, when it becomes harmful, and how to recognize the warning signs before simple scripts turn into hard-to-maintain systems. â€”By Chris Woody Woodruff .NET 10 Networking Improvements - .NET Blog .NET 10 introduces key networking upgrades, including faster HTTP performance with optional certificate validation caching, a new QUERY HTTP verb for safe requests with bodies, and a modern stream-based WebSocket API that dramatically simplifies message handling. The release also improves security with public CookieException support and TLS 1.3 on macOS. â€”By Marie PÃ­chovÃ¡ Implementing Cross-Platform In-App Billing in .NET MAUI Applications - .NET Blog A new .NET MAUI BillingService sample shows how to implement cross-platform in-app purchases for Android, iOS/Mac Catalyst, and Windows using platform-specific APIs behind a single unified interface. The sample demonstrates clean architecture with dependency injection, MVVM, and conditional compilation, and provides a production-ready client-side solution, with guidance on platform setup and a future path toward StoreKit 2. â€”By Gerald Versluis Microsoft Learn MCP Server Elevates Development - .NET Blog Microsoft Learn MCP Server integrates with GitHub Copilot to provide accurate, up-to-date Microsoft documentation and code samples directly inside your editor. It reduces hallucinations, improves context-aware code suggestions, and helps developers learn and solve problems faster without leaving their development tools. â€”By Eric Imasogie | Wendy Breiding Azure Cosmos DB : Becoming a Search-Native Database - Azure Cosmos DB Blog Azure Cosmos DB is evolving into a search-native database, blurring the traditional line between OLTP databases and search systems like Elasticsearch. By building on its distributed, schema-free JSON model and highly optimized inverted index, Azure Cosmos DB now natively supports full-text search, vector similarity search, hybrid ranking, and semantic re-ranking. This convergence enables AI-first, low-latency applications to perform transactional queries and semantic search in a single systemâ€”without the overhead of maintaining separate databases and search engines. â€”By Samer Boshra | Harsha Simhadri | Hari Sudan Aspire 13.1 - Our holiday gift to you Aspire 13.1 delivers a polished update focused on making AI coding agents first-class citizens in your workflow, alongside smoother CLI experience, smarter dashboards, improved Azure deployments, and end-to-end HTTPS support for local development. â€”By David Fowler .NET and .NET Framework December 2025 servicing releases updates - .NET Blog The December 2025 servicing update refreshes .NET 10 to version 10.0.1, delivering non-security fixes across the runtime, SDK, ASP.NET Core, WinForms, Entity Framework Core, and tooling. There are no new updates for .NET Framework this month, and developers are encouraged to upgrade to the latest service release. â€”By Tara Overfield | .NET Team Making Windows Terminal awesome with GitHub Copilot CLI - Microsoft for Developers A practical guide to customizing Windows Terminal and boosting productivity with GitHub Copilot CLIâ€”showing how to personalize your terminal, integrate AI assistance directly in the command line, and enhance prompts with tools like Oh My Posh for a smoother, faster developer workflow. â€”By Kayla Cinnamon How to Build iOS Widgets with .NET MAUI - .NET Blog A concise guide showing that iOS widgets can be built professionally with .NET MAUI, combining MAUI with Xcode and Swift. The article focuses on real-world architecture, common pitfalls, and key conceptsâ€”from bundle IDs and widget lifecycles to data flow and iconsâ€”helping developers avoid fragile setups and build stable, interactive iOS widgets. â€”By Anthonius de Boer Enterprise Patterns, Real Code: Implementing Fowlerâ€™s Ideas in C# A concise introduction to a C# article series that makes Martin Fowlerâ€™s enterprise patterns explicit instead of accidental. It explains how common patterns already appear in ASP.NET applications, shows when to use or avoid them, and demonstrates how they combine into real, maintainable architectures with concrete C# code. â€”By Chris Woody Woodruff Getting Started with Concurrency Control in .NET A concise overview of concurrency control in .NET, explaining why synchronization matters and how primitives like lock, the new .NET 9 Lock type, Semaphore, and async-friendly SemaphoreSlim help safely coordinate access to shared resources in multithreaded applications. â€”By Nikola KneÅ¾eviÄ‡ Implementing Large File Uploads and Downloads in Azure Blob Storage With .NET A practical guide to handling large file uploads and downloads in .NET using Azure Blob Storage, covering storage setup, container configuration, and safe upload strategiesâ€”highlighting why simple uploads work for small files but chunked uploads are essential for large, multi-GB files. â€”By Anton Martyniuk LinkedInâ€™de okumaya devam edin [URL]~mjrm7bpg~ra-null-null&eid=flpa7u-mjrm7bpg-ra&otpToken=MWIwMTFkZTQxNjJhY2JjNWJjMjQwNGVkNDAxOWU3YjA4ZmNhZDg0NDlmYWM4YzYxNzljNTA4NmU0ZjVhNTRmMWY3ZDRkZmJhNjRiM2U0ZTYwM2FjZTM0Nzc1N2Y2MmM2NjQ0NDE5YWUyMDI1NzJlZDcxMjg0YiwxLDE%3D ---------------------------------------- Bu e-posta, Ali Edip Mangtay (Software Engineer ) iÃ§in gÃ¶nderilmiÅŸtir Buna neden yer verdiÄŸimizi Ã¶ÄŸrenin: [URL]~mjrm7bpg~ra-null-null&eid=flpa7u-mjrm7bpg-ra&otpToken=MWIwMTFkZTQxNjJhY2JjNWJjMjQwNGVkNDAxOWU3YjA4ZmNhZDg0NDlmYWM4YzYxNzljNTA4NmU0ZjVhNTRmMWY3ZDRkZmJhNjRiM2U0ZTYwM2FjZTM0Nzc1N2Y2MmM2NjQ0NDE5YWUyMDI1NzJlZDcxMjg0YiwxLDE%3D LinkedIn bildirim e-postalarÄ± alÄ±yorsunuz. text: Happy New Year!âœˆï¸ğŸ‰ Dear Guest, we are leaving behind another year filled with unforgettable moments shared with you in the sky. Click here if you can't display this e-mail.Dear Guest, We are leaving behind another year filled with unforgettable moments shared with you in the sky. 2025 was an instructive and challenging year for all of us, with changing dynamics around the world and in TÃ¼rkiye. During this period, we maintained our service philosophy; as always, we focused on providing you with the easiest travel experience and accompanying you on your dream journeys. In a changing world, we remained true to our service philosophy; as always, we focused on offering the easiest travel experience and being part of your long-awaited reunions. The exciting dream we had when we started our scheduled flights exactly 20 years ago has now become a global success story. With this vision, we continued to expand our fleet, open new routes and make our investments with determination in 2025. We strengthened our international growth vision with strategic steps such as the Czech Airlines and its subsidiary Smartwings investment. We have opened a new chapter in our international brand journey with the global partnership we have launched with Chelsea FC, one of the most recognised in the World of sports clubs. We have always charted our course with your satisfaction at the heart of everything we do. We have enjoyed witnessing your most precious moments, with each journey made easier through the power of technology. As we enter a new year, there is a sense of excitement ahead. In 2026, we will continue to cross borders, make the world more accessible and bridge the distances between you and your loved ones. We remain committed to leaving a cleaner sky for future generations and will take even more determined steps towards sustainable aviation. Thank you for your trust in us and for sharing this journey. May your journeys always lead to enjoyable adventures and to your loved ones. May 2026 bring you and all your loved ones health and happiness. subject: Building a Machine Learning Platform - The Trendyol way
text: Building a Machine Learning Platform - The Trendyol way Trendyol Newsletter Yazan: Trendyol Group Yazan: Trendyol Group Sohbete katÄ±lmak iÃ§in LinkedInâ€™deki bu makaleyi okuyun LinkedInâ€˜de oku [URL]~mjr0rpcp~3d-null-null&eid=flpa7u-mjr0rpcp-3d&otpToken=MWIwMTFkZTQxNjJhY2JjNWJjMjQwNGVkNDAxOWU3YjQ4YmNkZDU0NjlmYWM4YTYxNzljNTA4NmU0ZjVhNTRmMWY3ZDRkZmIwNjdjZGMxODY3ZWZlZTg0NWRjYmFiYzU0ODgzODhlMGNmOGZkYWYxYTc5MGI3YiwxLDE%3D Trendyol Tech Newsletter no:2 Welcome to a new edition of the Trendyol Tech Newsletter. This month, we take a closer look at Building a Machine Learning Platform, the Trendyol way. Beyond theory, beyond architecture slidesâ€”this is how our teams design, operate, and evolve an ML platform that supports hundreds of real-world use cases across Trendyol Tech. From infrastructure decisions to platform capabilities and trade-offs, this edition is a hands-on look at what it actually takes to run machine learning systems in production. If youâ€™re curious about how ML platforms look beyond diagramsâ€”and how they actually operate in real lifeâ€”youâ€™re in the right place. Letâ€™s get into the details. What is a Machine Learning Platform and why are we building it? The tech world has been creating machine learning products for a while. At Trendyol, we generate value from ML products within wide-range e-commerce domains including but not limited to personalization, recommendation, forecasting, fraud, computer vision, logistic optimizations etc. Industry best practices and well known tools have gotten us so far but Trendyol scale - wide range of domains, limitless iterations, aggressive agility, high throughput, petabytes of data - required tailor made solutions. To cover the need, we are developing ML Platform to provide our colleagues with toolsets for feature engineering, experimentation and inference needs. Our fundamental approach aims to decrease cognitive load coming from technical obstacles and create more focus on business applications. Our way of building the ML systems Our understanding of platform efforts consists of three main categories: Enablement: Taking teams and projects from 0 to 1 by introducing domains with ML capabilities. Acceleration: Going from 1 to 100 with rapid iterations, addressing and removing bottlenecks. Optimization: Making 100 more effective, reliable and maintainable. These efforts include both platform tools and ways of working definitions. A typical ML project is executed by data scientists and engineers. They create value by implementing and iterating a project lifecycle and ML Platform team and tools are meant to support them at every step in this lifecycle. The image below summarizes an ideal ML project lifecycle from a high level point of view. Letâ€™s deep dive into the steps one by one! Ideation and preparation Each ML project begins with an idea - a problem, model or feature. To experiment with an idea, a data scientist needs a development environment and related toolset to play with data and algorithms. Our main analytical data storage solutions are BigQuery and GCS buckets which are the beginning points for almost every project where the data is collected through our data engineering and data platform teams. The next part is a development environment that ML Platform provides. These environments come with main ingredients - Jupyter notebook, computation power, compatible drivers and libraries of choice, a disk for local storage, connection with shared file systems etc. Data is available and the environment is up and running, the data scientist now can conduct explanatory data analysis, feature experiments, model trials and evaluations. From a platform point of view, one of the most challenging parts of this step is to provide computation power in a reliable and optimized way. We utilize Kubeflow notebooks for this purpose. Users can select memory, CPU, disk and GPU specs according to their needs. We provide various options Preconfigured docker images for popular libraries like TensorFlow and PyTorch can be selected when creating environments to get to work rapidly. Dependencies and versions are configured and tested by the ML Platform team to achieve maximum reliability possible. How do we optimize usage and keep costs under control for environments? It is a whole other story to tell, look out for upcoming articles. Model training Once the preparations are done, it is time for the actual model training. The data scientist decided on the features and the algorithm to experiment on at this point. Feature engineering with a sample data set is straightforward but when you are to train a model with real data, features become harder to calculate. In fact, feature engineering typically consumes the largest chunk of a Data Scientistâ€™s time. Creating reliable, scalable, and point-in-time correct features for production is a different beast. To bridge the gap between raw data and ML models, we built our internal Feature Store solution: Panama. It acts as the centralized refinery where raw "ore" (data) is transformed into "gold" (features) through authorized pipelines. Beyond just technical abstraction, it tries to solve critical challenges: it drastically reduces the time and effort required to create models, maximizes feature reusability across teams, standardizes feature definitions, and ultimately improves consistency and data quality. Our architecture is designed to support both high-volume batch processing and low-latency streaming needs without compromising on scale. For batch processing, we ingest large-scale data from our Data Warehouse or SSDP (Trendyolâ€™s Self Service Data Platform) data products, processing them via SQL transformations orchestrated by Cloud Composer. On the streaming front, we consume real-time events from Kafka and utilize Apache Flink to process and convert them into features instantly. A valuable capability we unlocked here is generating training data directly from these streaming sources; after computation with Flink, we store this training data in Iceberg format, registered in the BigQuery Metastore. Currently hosting 1,350 batches and 50 streaming feature groups, our Feature Store utilizes both offline and online storage layers. We use BigQuery as our offline store, managing over 700 TB of data; and to offer flexibility, features can also be exported directly from BigQuery to GCS. For the online store, which is optimized for high-speed, low-latency access, we rely on Couchbase. It accommodates 12 TB of data, ensuring that our models always have the data they need, the moment they need it. To serve batch features in this online store, we use Cloud Dataproc to handle the ingestion and synchronization process efficiently. From a developer experience perspective, a Data Scientist defines a feature group using a YAML-based Contract File. This contract includes metadata (owners, descriptions), time granularity, and specific feature logic. Once a feature is defined, the platform handles the rest, making the feature available via our API and Python SDK without any further manual intervention. After features are created and available from the Feature Store, the algorithm can be executed by ingesting those features. While training, we ensure that only anonymized data is utilized in compliance with KVKK (Personal Data Protection Law) and GDPR requirements, adhering strictly to the boundaries of user consent. Some model training efforts may require advanced data ingestion strategies, especially when you are dealing with unstructured data. We utilize parallel file systems to solve small file problems occurring during such cases to accelerate data ingestions. A related article can be found at the link The same notebook from the development environment can also be used for executing trainings. Environments give enough computation power for most of the cases however some deep learning cases may require more. Our Flex Jobs module addresses those needs. Flex Jobs utilizes Kueue with GCPâ€™s DWS system to provide data scientists with GPUs such as A100, H100 and H200. Our standard approach suggests extracting a training output as an artifact. Any format is acceptable - a json, pickle or ONNX runtime. This is because model management is an essential part of the lifecycle. Our Model Management system consists of a registry backed by GCS buckets, a versioning system, a model card for metadata and key metrics definitions and special tags for further usage. The model card also holds experiment tracking integration for MLFlow experiments. In this sense the model card is a record store for our experiments and models, acts as the source of truth for contracts between stakeholders and reliable storage for our artifacts. Test and evaluation Training can be executed multiple times with different parameters, configs, features to achieve accuracy or KPI goals. Experiment tracking tools help data scientists to benchmark their executions. Our model card module introduces a simple storage for this purpose. Powerful tools like MLFlow or Weights&Biases also give much more insights for accuracy metrics. Certain domains cannot define accuracy only with prepared data. Our data scientist colleagues run business KPI simulations on sample data from production systems for those domains. As we get closer to the production, each change introduced - pre/post process codes, inference servers, quantizations or caches - requires reassessment of the model. Nobody got time for that repeating process. Our pipeline solution, Piper, introduces pythonic components to automate any part of the lifecycle. Whether it is an offline prediction or an evaluation pipeline, our colleagues can implement their needs easily with the component library that Piper provides. Online and offline serving Now we are confident that our model will work. There are two main ways to use it in production, batch prediction and live inference. Batch predictions run periodically or as one-off jobs. Our Flex Jobs or Airflow jobs backed by ML platform jobs infrastructure are currently popular options in our organization. Ingest features as a batch from our offline store, feed them to your model and process the output - easy and effective. Batch predictions cover the majority of our business needs for now. Live inference, however, is more tricky. Ideal deployment pipeline consists of verification of the model artifact, applying inference server of choice and our best practices for their configuration, deployment configurations for domain needs and a smoke test to ensure successful deployment. Runtime requirements differ much according to business domains. Piper has inference components for all of them. Low traffic models: Python services for prediction scripts that can be consumed with HTTP requests or Kafka events. Deployments are triggered through our developer platform, TBP (Trendyol Builder Platform). High throughput models: Distributed and auto scaled predictions using Ray serve. Model response times are not so critical for those. Low latency models: Nvidia Triton deployments with gRPC services and Istio load balancing With the advancements in Piper, we managed to automate the model deployment pipeline but there are still uncovered areas. Especially for low latency models, our way of working suggests defining traffic and latency needs from model cards. With the essential information in hand, ML Platform team provides support for optimizing live inference services manually. This approach aims to ensure the reliability of high throughput - low latency customer faced products. Optimization step is the time when we decide whether a model can be run on CPUs or we should use GPUs for optimal performance. We have 130+ GPUs operating within our data centers for now - A100, H100 and H200 of type. Priority usage of them is reserved for low latency customer faced models within our standards. Live inference challenges are not limited to models but also requires an advanced approach for our online feature store. Handling thousands of requests per minute, our online store faces intense read pressure that can lead to data hotspots, threatening both performance and scalability. To counter this, we developed a Data Service API that utilizes a consistent hashing algorithm. With this strategy, we route identical requests to the specific Kubernetes pod, allowing us to consolidate duplicate queries into a single execution queue. Following a cache-first logic, the system checks memory first; data is returned instantly upon a cache hit, and Couchbase is queried only on a miss. This architecture drastically reduces redundant database trips, alleviates strain on the Couchbase cluster, and maximizes overall system efficiency. Another serving solution that ML platform offers is for AI models, LLMs or VLMs. Piper has components also for serving models with vLLM, SGlang and LMDeploy. We deploy both internal and open source models through them and enable our organization to utilize AI capabilities. Those models are behind a GenAI Gateway implementation developed by extending LiteLLM answering our enterprise needs. Until now, we integrated 50 internal and external models to the system. Monitoring Voila! You are in production. Butâ€¦ After all, a model is successful as long as it meets our business needs. Common practice to assess that within our organization is to conduct A/B tests. Domains check for business metrics with those tests through our experimentation platform, Janus, and decide whether the model is champion or needs another iteration. Another way of deciding a champion model is production accuracy results. Usage cost is the driver of ROI decisions. Resource allocation and utilization metrics are transparent for company resources. We are working on detecting data and model drift at scale. And of course, there are dashboards, alarms and logs for throughput, response time and error rate for inference services through our monitoring platform, Beholder. An ML Platform is a developer experience product in the end. We produce lifecycle metrics through analytics from usage of our products. Improving business KPIs through agility is our main goal. At scale even 1% uplift is enough to celebrate an iteration and we are trying to achieve hundreds of them. A good example of that is the collaborative efforts of Search Data Science, Search Relevancy and ML Platform teams. Within one year, search algorithms have been iterated 100+ times with 50% champion rate. Those systems received ~1M rpm throughput and features are queried with ~6M rpm during peak times of the November campaigns period. Future ahead Right now, we are working on expanding the capabilities of Piper to enable more pipelines and automations. Manual steps are to be automated to achieve acceleration for all steps of the continuous lifecycle. A smooth data experience is critical when you operate on Trendyol scale. Not just creating and scaling, but also monitoring and reliability - data quality, drift detection, pipeline automations, retention and recreation. We are collaborating with our colleagues from the Data Management tribe to provide data scientists and ML engineers with those abilities. We embedded creating and presenting real life case studies to our own development lifecycle, as one of the most crucial parts of developing a platform is technical documentation and example guides. Live inference optimizations for achieving response time or throughput SLAs are still done manually and must be automated. We are trying to standardize our efforts and make those automations generally available though Piper. Costly and limited computation resources should be allocated in a business effective and smart way - autoscale up and down with dynamic hybrid allocation. Should we keep letting GPUs be idle when they are under much less load during night time? Feature storage and serving needs a different approach from application databases. Agility in data storage must be achieved from database infra to developer experience point of view. Can we create a versatile database system specifically for online feature stores? We are expanding our toolset for the AI era. Generic models - LLMs and VLMs should be easily accessible, reliable and scalable - of course with cost optimizations. Does every solution require generic LLMs or can we manage a fleet of business specific AI models by enabling domains more? Stay tuned for answers! That wraps up this deep dive into how we build and run our Machine Learning Platform at Trendyol Tech. As always, weâ€™re curious about what you want to explore next. Which technical topics should we break down? What challenges are you tackling? Which teams or systems would you like to hear from? subject: Why consistency beats intensity
text: Why consistency beats intensity Edip, Most beginners think success comes from doing a lot in a short time. Long sessions. Big plans. High effort days followed by nothing. That approach burns people out fast. What actually works is consistency. Small actions. Repeated often. Built on something stable. One product test per day beats one perfect weekend. One small improvement beats a full rebuild. One week of steady learning beats one intense sprint. This only works if your foundation does not change every day. That is why many beginners start with a ready made store. The structure stays fixed. The products stay live. You can focus on learning instead of restarting. A Tradelle ready made store gives you that stability: âœ… Clean structure that does not need constant changes âœ… Products with real demand âœ… Fulfillment already handled âœ… Ready in under 24 hours âœ… 304â€‘step optimization checklist âœ… 30â€‘day moneyâ€‘back guarantee [URL] ğŸ‘‰ Claim Your Ready-Made Store If you want to see how professionals build consistency from day one and avoid burnout, the free live webinar on Monday walks through the full beginner process and answers all open questions. subject: New GDG on Campus Istinye University - Istanbul,TÃ¼rkiye event: Python Workshop
text: New GDG on Campus Istinye University - Istanbul,TÃ¼rkiye event: Python Workshop Hey Edip,Donâ€™t miss our next event: Python Workshop About the event: The Python Workshop is designed to introduce participants to the fundamentals of the Python programming language and provide a structured entry point into coding. The workshop focuses on core programming concepts, basic syntax, and foundational logic required for writing simple Python programs.The sessions will be conducted in an online format via Google Meet, allowing participants to attend remotely. Throughout the workshop, participants are guided through introductory-level topics aimed at developing computational thinking and basic problem-solving skills.The content is specifically structured for individuals with little or no prior programming experience, ensuring a clear and accessible learning progression. The workshop aims to support participants in gaining initial familiarity with programming concepts and building a foundation for further learning in software development and related technical fields. subject: Don't Let Valentine's Meet Delays
text: Don't Let Valentine's Meet Delays Preview Content Valentine's 2026 overlaps with CNYâ€”early planning matters. Valentine's Day 2026 falls right around Chinese New Year, which means tighter production schedules and longer fulfillment timelines. Sellers who plan early avoid last-minute delays and missed sales. subject: Why some beginners succeed faster
text: Why some beginners succeed faster Edip, There is one habit that shows up again and again in people who learn dropshipping fast. They do not ask, â€œIs this perfect?â€ They ask, â€œWhat did this teach me?â€ Every action becomes feedback. A product that gets clicks but no carts teaches pricing or trust. A page that gets scrolls but no clicks teaches clarity. A store that gets visits teaches more than one that stays offline. This habit changes everything because it removes pressure. Nothing has to be perfect. Everything has to be observable. To build this habit, you need two things: A setup that works from the start. And the willingness to look at feedback instead of opinions. That is why many beginners start with a ready made store. It gives them a stable base so every test actually teaches something. A Tradelle ready made store gives you that base: âœ… Clean structure âœ… 20 products with proven demand âœ… Automated fulfillment with fast delivery âœ… Expert review before you go live âœ… 304â€‘step growth checklist âœ… 30â€‘day moneyâ€‘back guarantee [URL] ğŸ‘‰ Claim Your Ready-Made Store If you want to get all your open questions answered and see how professionals think through these decisions step by step, there is a free live webinar happening on Monday . It walks through the full beginner process with real examples and is completely free. Reserve your free spot [URL] here .
