subject: Proof of Usefulness Hackathon: Win $100K+ from Bright Data, Neo4j, Algolia, Storyblok & HackerNoon
text: Proof of Usefulness Hackathon: Win $100K+ from Bright Data, Neo4j, Algolia, Storyblok & HackerNoon Submit your Project to Proof its Usefulness Now! Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ <[URL] Hi @, Happy New Year, world! As a New Year gift, HackerNoon brings you the biggest Dev Hackathon of the year. The internet is overflowing with software that looks impressive, sounds intelligent, and quietly fails to help anyone. Weâ€™ve normalized pitch decks for products that donâ€™t exist, AI demos with no users, and MVPs that launch with applause and vanish without a trace. Meanwhile, people still need tools that work. So weâ€™re doing something different. Enters <[URL] the Proof of Usefulness Hackathon! From January 5 to June 5, this is a global developer competition that rewards one thing and one thing only: Real-world usefulness. And yes, thereâ€™s $100,000+ in cash and software prizes for winners & $1500+ for participating projects that can prove it. This hackathon is supported by companies that care about production software, not just demos: <[URL] Bright Data, <[URL] Neo4j, <[URL] Storyblok, <[URL] Algolia, and <[URL] HackerNoon. <[URL] Note: Individual developers and budding startups are welcome to participate, with access to free tools that help you build and promote something meaningful. Any technology is welcome, but bigger prizes are reserved for AI and ML projects that use sponsor technologies. <[URL] Submit to Proof of Usefulness Now! Letâ€™s Start With the Prizes This isnâ€™t a weekend hackathon where one team wins, and everyone else disappears. Proof of Usefulness runs for six months, with monthly rewards and ongoing recognition for winners, 40+ winners, as well as $1500 worth of inventory for each participant. <[URL] Cash Prizes: $20,000 Awarded monthly across the contest, recognizing both individual builders and startups. â€¢ Bright Data: $10,000 (10 winners Ã— $1,000) â€¢ HackerNoon: $5,000 (10 winners Ã— $500) â€¢ Storyblok: $5,000 (6 monthly winners) <[URL] Software Credits: $70,000+ Because useful software deserves real infrastructure. â€¢ Bright Data: $60,000 - 3 startup winners Ã— $20,000 - One winner per bimonthly cycle (Janâ€“Feb, Marâ€“Apr, Mayâ€“Jun) â€¢ Neo4j: $10,000 - 10 winners Ã— $1,000 â€¢ Algolia: - 6 winners get 6 months of premium Algolia access And hereâ€™s the part most hackathons donâ€™t give you: Every participant is eligible for rewards! <[URL] Participation Rewards: â€¢ Bright Data: $250 in free credits. Learn more <[URL] here. â€¢ Storyblok: $540 worth of 45 days of access to the Growth+ plan. Learn more <[URL] here. â€¢ Neo4j: AuraDB Free for all participants. Learn more <[URL] here. â€¢ Algolia: Build tier Free for all participants. Learn more <[URL] here. â€¢ HackerNoon: $750 worth of publishing and promotion credits for startups. Learn more <[URL] here. How the Timeline Works â€¢ January 5th â€“ June 5th: Rolling submissions â€¢ Every month: Cash and software prize winners announced â€¢ Every two months: Major software prize cycles â€¢ June/July: Final awards and top projects spotlighted Submit when your product is ready. No deadlines designed to force half-built demos. <[URL] Who Can Submit A valid submission includes: â€¢ A working project URL â€¢ Complete project information â€¢ Claims that can be verified in the real world No mockups. No â€œcoming soon.â€ No vibes-only prototypes. Note: Projects falling under any of the sponsored themes and utilizing the sponsor tools unlock free software and tools worth $1500 and qualify for bigger prizes. The Contest Tags (~Themes) Projects are published and evaluated under focused themes as HackerNoon tags, including: Foundational Tech & Builder Innovation sponsored by HackerNoon Machine learning and AI, software engineering, security, startups, fintech innovation, and Web3 technologies. Here are the tags sponsored by <[URL] HackerNoon: â€¢ <[URL] #software-development â€¢ <[URL] #machine-learning â€¢ <[URL] #software-engineering â€¢ <[URL] #security â€¢ <[URL] #startup â€¢ <[URL] #fintech â€¢ <[URL] #web3 HackerNoon is giving away <[URL] $750 in publishing and promotion credits to all qualifying startups. This is your chance to showcase your startup to global audiences. Data Infrastructure, AI & Automation sponsored by Bright Data Web data extraction and access, APIs, automation, data science pipelines, AI and generative AI applications, and agent-driven systems powered by large-scale datasets. Here are the sponsored tags by Bright Data: â€¢ <[URL] #ai â€¢ <[URL] #generative-ai â€¢ <[URL] #ai-agents â€¢ <[URL] #web-development â€¢ <[URL] #data-science â€¢ <[URL] #api â€¢ <[URL] #automation â€¢ <[URL] #data To participate in the theme powered by Bright Data, you qualify for $250 in free software credits to create a great use case. <[URL] Click here to claim your free credits. Modern Content Architecture sponsored by Storyblock API-first and headless CMS architectures, omnichannel content delivery, composable and frontend-agnostic content systems, and scalable content infrastructure for developers. Here are the sponsored tags by Storyblok: â€¢ <[URL] #cms â€¢ <[URL] #headless-cms â€¢ <[URL] #api-first-cms â€¢ <[URL] #first-cms â€¢ <[URL] #omnichannel-content Storyblock is giving away <[URL] $524 worth of free Growth+ Access to all participants in this theme. Build a beautiful, functional project with StoryBlock and win $$$ in cash. Graph-Powered Intelligence sponsored by Neo4j Graph databases, knowledge graphs, data intelligence, contextual retrieval, GraphRAG, and graph-powered AI agents for connected data use cases. Here are the sponsored tags by Neo4j. â€¢ <[URL] #graph-database â€¢ <[URL] #knowledge-graph â€¢ <[URL] #data-intelligence â€¢ <[URL] #graph-rag â€¢ <[URL] #contextual-retrieval â€¢ <[URL] #graph-powered-agents To build a project using Neo4j, use their <[URL] free version (Aura DB). Intelligent Search & Retrieval sponsored by Algolia AI-powered search, semantic and relevance-based retrieval, search APIs, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) for fast, user-centric discovery experiences. Here are the sponsored tags by Algolia: â€¢ <[URL] #ai-search â€¢ <[URL] #retrieval â€¢ <[URL] #retrieval-augmented-generation â€¢ <[URL] #semantic-search â€¢ <[URL] #search-api Build a kick-ass AI search project using <[URL] Algoliaâ€™s free Build Tier. What â€œProof of Usefulnessâ€ Actually Means Proof of Usefulness (PoU) is HackerNoonâ€™s way of measuring what most demos avoid. It asks: â€¢ Do people use this? â€¢ Does it solve a real problem? â€¢ Can it survive outside a launch tweet? Every submission receives a PoU score from -100 to [PHONE] based on empirical evidence, with seven distinct tiers: <[URL] The algorithm cross-validates responses against publicly available data, ensuring projects can't simply claim utility without demonstrating it. Evaluation Criteria and Weight Distribution <[URL] Why Weâ€™re Doing This The web doesnâ€™t need more software optimized for screenshots. It needs tools that: â€¢ Actually work after launch â€¢ Earn their place through use â€¢ Create value without hype <[URL] â€œThe most exciting breakthroughs happen when teams leverage open web access to address real-world challenges. At Bright Data, we believe usefulness starts with connecting people and AI to the worldâ€™s live informationâ€”transforming ideas into impact.â€ â€” Or Lenchner, CEO of Bright Data â€œProof of usefulness in our world comes down to one thing: does your CMS help developers ship better and faster, or does it slow them down? Hype doesnâ€™t build products. Real utility does. Thatâ€™s the standard Storyblok is built to meet.â€ - Storyblock team "As a manager of a developer relations organization, I see a lot of hackathons where the results are toys or novelties. By emphasizing usefulness, Hacker Noon forces participants to put on their product hats and really build something thatâ€™s going to help the end user." Chuck Meyer, Sr Manager, Developer Relations at Algolia Thatâ€™s the whole thesis. <[URL] Why You Should Participate (Even If You Donâ€™t Win) Youâ€™ll get: â€¢ A free Proof of Usefulness evaluation â€¢ An instant PoU score and report â€¢ A ready-made blog post showcasing your work to global tech audiences â€¢ Eligibility for free software worth $1500+ for every participant â€¢ Eligibility for $100,000+ in prizes â€¢ Public validation & promotion by HackerNoon And if nothing else, youâ€™ll walk away knowing where your project stands, in reality, not theory. Submissions Are Open If your product is live, useful, and ready to be judged on reality, not hype - this is for you. Submit your project. Get your score. Prove itâ€™s useful. Compete for $100K+. <[URL] Submit to Proof of Usefulness Now! Proof of Usefulness Hackathon: Become an Ecosystem Partner If you support developers, educate tech talent, run a tech community, or create content for builders, <[URL] become Proof of Usefulness Official Ecosystem Partner <[URL] ! Partners get: â€¢ Official Recognition: Your logo and name featured on the main hackathon website as an official University, Community, Influencer, or Ecosystem Partner â€¢ Earn Judge Status: Top referring partners may be selected as Official Judges, earning voting power and global recognition â€¢ Empower Your Community: 100k+ in prizes & $1,000+ in software tools per participant - major startup-ready stacks from Bright Data, Neo4j, Storyblok, and Algolia â€¢ Co-Branded Cross-Promotion: Get featured in Hackathon newsletters and other marketing materials <[URL] Become Proof of Usefulness Official Ecosystem Partner! With love & treat your internet friends with respect, The HackerNoon Team âœŒï¸ About HackerNoon's Proof of Usefulness Hackathon <[URL] Proof of Usefulness Hackathon is a global 6-month developer challenge designed to reward real-world utility projects and initiatives. With 100,000+ in cash prizes and software credits for winners and $1500+ worth of software and inventory for participants, this is undisputedly the biggest contest of the year. Learn more <[URL] here. Meet our sponsors: Bright Data: Bright Data is the leading web data infrastructure company, empowering over 20,000 organizations with ethical, scalable access to real-time public web information. From startups to industry leaders, we deliver the datasets that fuel AI innovation and real-world impact. Ready to unlock the web? Learn more at <[URL] brightdata.com. Neo4j: GraphRAG combines retrieval-augmented generation with graph-native context, allowing LLMs to reason over structured relationships instead of just documents. With Neo4j, you can build GraphRAG pipelines that connect your data and surface clearer insights. <[URL] Learn more. Storyblock: Storyblok is a headless CMS built for developers who want clean architecture and full control. Structure your content once, connect it anywhere, and keep your front end truly independent. API-first. AI-ready. Framework-agnostic. Future-proof. <[URL] Start for free. Algolia: Algolia provides a managed retrieval layer that lets developers quickly build web search and intelligent AI agents. <[URL] Learn more. <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] To unsubscribe from this email, click <[URL] here <[URL]

If you support developers, run a tech community, or create content for builders, you know this: the internet doesn't need more demo-day darlings. It needs tools that survive real users. That's why HackerNoon is running <[URL] Proof of Usefulness, a six-month global hackathon that rewards real-world utility over pitch deck promises. This hackathon is supported by companies that care about production software, not just demos. Meet Bright Data, Neo4j, Storyblok, Algolia, and yours truly, HackerNoon. And we want you as an official partner, helping developers worldwide build software that matters while earning recognition, influence, and exclusive perks. If you nurture tech talent, you belong here! <[URL] ğŸ‘‰ Apply here to join the Partner Program Meet Proof of Usefulness <[URL] Proof of Usefulness is HackerNoon's validation system that measures what actually matters: real utility instead of polished demos, technical theatrics, or pitch deck projections. It's a competition where projects are scored from -1000 to [PHONE] based on empirical evidence of user adoption, revenue sustainability, technical stability, and genuine utility. Become a Proof of Usefulness Partner Join a global initiative inviting developers to build impactful, real-world projects. Running from January 5th to June 5th, 2026, the hackathon features $100k+ in cash & software prizes and attracts thousands of builders worldwide. Here's how we partner: You bring the developers, we bring the platform, prizes, and global reach. Together, we validate real innovation, expand your influence, and put your name in front of a global audience of builders, innovators, and tech decision-makers for six months straight. Win-win-win, isnâ€™t it? <[URL] Why Partner With Us? ğŸ’š Official Reconition: Your logo and name featured on the main hackathon website as an official University, Community, Influencer, or Ecosystem Partner ğŸ’š Earn Judge Status: Top referring partners may be selected as Official Judges with voting power to determine hackathon winners across cash and software prize categories ğŸ’š Empower Your Community: $1,000+ in software tools per participant - major startup-ready stacks from Bright Data, Neo4j, Storyblok, and Algolia ğŸ’š Exclusive Partner Perks: Early feature announcements, co-branded content opportunities, and dedicated support channel Who Can Join the Partner Program We're looking for three types of partners to amplify this movement: Universities and Academic Partners: Turn your students' projects into portfolio-ready achievements with real validation and professional tools â–ªï¸Computer Science departments â–ªï¸Labs & research centers â–ªï¸Robotics, AI/ML, Web3 clubs â–ªï¸Student developer societies Developer & Community Partners: Give your members the spotlight they deserve, complete with scoring, prizes, and recognition from industry leaders. â–ªï¸Tech meetups â–ªï¸Online dev communities â–ªï¸Open-source groups â–ªï¸Bootcamps and training academies Influencer Partners: Show your audience how to turn their side projects into validated, prize-winning software, while positioning yourself as the connector who made it happen. â–ªï¸Developer YouTubers/TikTokers â–ªï¸Tech writers & bloggers â–ªï¸X/Twitter influencers â–ªï¸Hackathon mentors and educators If you nurture tech talent, you're a perfect match. Partner Responsibilities What we need from you is simple: 1. Share the hackathon with your audience 2. Encourage project submissions 3. Post announcements on your channels 4. Optionally host info sessions or workshops No administrative burden - just community empowerment. <[URL] More About The Hackathon Proof of Usefulness runs for six months, from January 5th to June 5th, 2026, with prizes announced monthly and 3 bimonthly software cycles from our $100k prize pool. Every project - and partner - benefits from 6 months of global visibility. Hello, exposure! Benefits for Participants â–ªï¸Global exposure through HackerNoon â–ªï¸Validation from industry judges â–ªï¸Powerful tools to build real products â–ªï¸Portfolio-ready project outcomes Who can participate? Anyone building useful software can participate! Whether you're a solo developer, startup team, or established company, if you have a project that solves real problems for real people, you're eligible. Projects can be existing products or new builds created specifically for the hackathon. Ready to Empower Real Innovation? Join us in celebrating software that actually works. Become an official partner and give your community access to the validation, tools, and recognition they deserve. <[URL] ğŸ‘‰ Apply here to join the Partner Program With love & treat your internet friends with respect, The HackerNoon Team âœŒï¸ About HackerNoon's Proof of Usefulness Hackathon <[URL] Proof of Usefulness Hackathon is a global 6-month developer challenge designed to reward real-world utility projects and initiatives. With 100,000+ in cash prizes and software credits for winners and $1500+ worth of software and inventory for participants, this is undisputedly the biggest contest of the year. Learn more <[URL] here. Meet our sponsors: Bright Data: Bright Data is the leading web data infrastructure company, empowering over 20,000 organizations with ethical, scalable access to real-time public web information. From startups to industry leaders, we deliver the datasets that fuel AI innovation and real-world impact. Ready to unlock the web? Learn more at <[URL] brightdata.com. Neo4j: GraphRAG combines retrieval-augmented generation with graph-native context, allowing LLMs to reason over structured relationships instead of just documents. With Neo4j, you can build GraphRAG pipelines that connect your data and surface clearer insights. <[URL] Learn more. Storyblock: Storyblok is a headless CMS built for developers who want clean architecture and full control. Structure your content once, connect it anywhere, and keep your front end truly independent. API-first. AI-ready. Framework-agnostic. Future-proof. <[URL] Start for free. Algolia: Algolia provides a managed retrieval layer that lets developers quickly build web search and intelligent AI agents. <[URL] Learn more. <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] To unsubscribe from this email, click <[URL] here <[URL]

subject: Issue 310: The top ten Stack Overflow blogs of 2025
text: Issue 310: The top ten Stack Overflow blogs of 2025 The Great Unracking, bad code coverage, and AI vs. Gen Z ************* The Overflow. ************* 31 December What luck for our 310 issue to land on the 31st! If you're practicing your numbers in preparation for the New Years' countdown, we're right there with you. We're counting down the top ten Stack Overflow blogs of 2025, and this week we've got the first five for your holiday reading pleasure. From popping the AI bubble to the ick you get from slop to the losing employment battle Gen Z is having against bots, this year's blogs dug deep into the economic, cultural, and technical shifts caused by AI in 2025. And don't worry, we wrote about stuff besides AI. Rounding out the first five of our countdown are the Great Unracking of our last physical datacenter, and a piece on making your codebase better by making your code coverage worse. If you're in more of a listening mood, you're in luck because the pod stops for no holiday. We're joined by former Stack Overflow board member Anil Dash for a conversation on how AI is normal and should be treated as such. We also spoke with Dan Ciruli from Nutanix about the delicate dance between VMs and Kubernetes in cloud-native environments. From around the web, we've got a piece on when we can expect quantum computing to be scalable (apparently it's imminent), one dev's reflection on a year of vibe coding, plus the disproving of the old developer proverb, "If you're as clever as you can be when you write your code, how will you ever debug it?" Wait, is that 2026 I see on the horizon? Let's countdown the end of this issue the way we always doâ€”with some questions. 5...What would Aristotle say about Cliff's Notes? 4...Will people believe me if I say the reason I don't understand advanced math is because its notation is not standardized? 3...What does "technically sound" mean? 2...Why won't my pirated disc of Brat work on my mom's 1999 CD player? 1...Happy New Year! Until next year, we have all those answers and so much more down in the links below. ------------- From the blog ------------- Settle down, nerds. AI is a normal technology ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/sP6b-UlwYpndKoBMmv0tbNT4f0sFB2K8-rx3LPLrIiI9199n4OBa5r7-dXM0waYgyhore7oXF1P6yzXHmot48LQDDAPrsUKSq6i2pCUMgF7IBbhUtcuSPq4OYau-y3oCfgC6HykaJ0s1jV20LHh_-D3xUi8oztTjXIjzJZ-vczKJwrUatbc0XUklRYkFQsrwli-kgqsXgXzaRlxB2MNwVw~~ ) stackoverflow.blog Ryan welcomes Anil Dash, writer and former Stack Overflow board member, back to the show to discuss how AI is not a magical technology, but rather the normal next step in computingâ€™s evolution. Containers are easyâ€”moving your legacy system off your VM is not ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/oex4wduSxywo-OwRmw0rq6C_jaCh0pNogWFBDODj1DjUveSeydBLkZkHweNeNJ5d7hjGnmW0UB4jXCFR7Mnb1tiTSgM7s72l1N2lNRrAeNO8zLs0ZMgbhWqdWzvBKZqxFMcEkpDUPUHXLFHTMvV2JB6bY6YHzuZqc9HVJIAzzW8kRDJ3ZU8osLEmhxfW7H-el-V8W4rvRlo_-6J--5FL3RakRyEv4vtlrJW8ujrg_cE~ ) stackoverflow.blog Ryan sits down with Dan Ciruli, VP and General Manager of Cloud Native at Nutanix, to talk about getting your virtual machines and Kubernetes to play nice in cloud-native environments, why VMs are still relevant in enterprise applications, and how AI can help modernize legacy systems. Making your code base better will make your code coverage worse ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/O93M1zca7GGZLawVZIfl-xGS3ss76cZrjJk60IqSQfPEgqZxhX1PJAD8yqtWskzb8vu-g772uPtb33Yb4S-YoVWJlQ54qSb7MjIYxoHTJzqWvitA84HHP9LwbvivyhYEKN8yQYgRJzJrLoCCad-MFa67qkX-41NNk_4JIH1WV3Kh9gwcTW744zX5tS-bxIdHPgtUKAfiB2fz9ipQ59ECeMVoNGBd2hyTFlhV-od6hjdJzWiu_K8Fnj3cjllOOnrltgGtMoBJr2qRWKlqVNYaCSn0cGP3TyGKeIxGg21r8iuveTgPhDMk-kdrc84nk44lxLnwtc7ov5TE10aLzI2y0w~~ ) stackoverflow.blog Maintaining a minimum of 80% code coverage affects code decisions and not always for the better. The AI ick ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/F_n3a_nzJGkRh-oa0yREN0U1kGWK_0V_MiSUgM5L2jO8zxEic48k5bp83Lk22nym3CpTIjt1PDzY81p5QOd7bkRR9No1SMPlGEXRu67G5mEp17i17XK_TAN4ntsrDYMqzvPxJn_eDULbovShT9waAgGSj0y1Nufw2Q7IJtErU5csrLraAOSDtaT0l4Z7VeGpI-qf_3LWGJfTfPH2rew_y5LUW3xXLRX8hMv4gf7LdP2SKo4gISe9CZUVINDtR8uTR0_-AJ-Jewn68BvAlVLnXA~~ ) stackoverflow.blog How we feel about AI-generated content, what AI detectors tell us, and why human creativity matters. Also, what is art? The Great Unracking: Saying goodbye to the servers at our physical datacenter ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/n5Rs-IbDitnrrN8SEtT6SCZo0fy_GpbAg9O2M_LqwF256u30krBPEEjmW2wAV_p4bi2wqNfiTsSAdtYZvx-kVQnyRNHlaYoEh2OzfRhEzfRWlpUWbk69hXU8YOcHkzjlCpTXcDugQWQmRBa7OemNLICT33pXAt8M3-NshwQK-FVlzHMHR4vrlBarTGI_pmUn2Kmm0JGYc7nTYEaxfC6RA9B3-NeN7toP0APKvNei6V35lUFCV6dZvWnHFuw1B_zM2KGioDTkAmKNt4HSCNhTEJIlKvV72AAgvT0iG-ecJ3rgJMAJDHQwGmUBv8o-qiOx3HRy0rfsJeKqxr9kZnHbY31sh_XZDutwSi9SdOEJaaA~ ) stackoverflow.blog So long and thanks for all the bits! Whether AI is a bubble or revolution, how does software survive? ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/3vYdrKMrJdVxrELQeduaccChFhyWy1jrgYq6hWO2wl775XH-VKXGClO8M5JV1fKqhAC1BCRcvm2iOUvVogQa86mt8HD_dvu0zrkPXIKdUqQNglWUxkHU98R0VuPHKuCQvIQuAjVOwMBxU7V3aH4BWnm6niYMgKbm0GymQ3F-kMO8M_ZVkXIHDEskDRk6_nwWlB24VHdC3u3FczfSr6rW00xs5qAY7pVEYYpjOxUvI_cfkGhdCqYCzU4fMvvvsKzlIN9As5XNhMktUsUysAZVV3dqcox0UV5-1-kQUA65ywg6UzoB9toivY8Ye8UuG74Vo15rWQ6fV9TCOC1Qss9OnQ~~ ) stackoverflow.blog Money is pouring into the AI industry. Will software survive the disruption it causes? AI vs Gen Z: How AI has changed the career pathway for junior developers ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/tmOsbFc8dO4kUwQlkOniawzwW17Ag1-X4Wg0LJJCqnmW4cG5Bv4TTw21zwD8yMlN_smgtmCA5QtPlLYO2QEeLA2SXSY-PsrBC_ppdON5d_j6d9yR-60BpMnmRhokSiQVd-IfXFmvwmOY09RAQ6f4BxpY7JFPYSl0gEusz3eG_1_yLyTEWEWweTAbupKpoyKo2Yl3QFpv0R9pcnnyZj3yW1zsTW1IIUmBNRbldoXrtTR99QQLxBDAkwFt4D92AfueKzJZX1ugt73-5UtS50gDrA~~ ) stackoverflow.blog For promising Gen Z students, a career as a software developer seemed like the golden ticket to career stability and success. But in the age of AI, the career promise for Gen Z software developers is gone. --------------------- Interesting questions --------------------- Where does the trouble older CD drives have reading newer burned discs come from? ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/lgjPosTQbHuilTAvaQRi15zxqkAwZuckLvjvVd88KsNs0cgK5kmI8WV_WwgbSTaCCE-_JzU5WSM4kS-iygfd0o1FTc_A5ML7jW7Fr6x_kAbydSI1_FvJ73yvnDvq-7gwpAe5FLaB_oB6-jTv98TE4ZX28kFz8aS8kNeWYP1B2CIlIyvYKwUOj2Cy1l0b34PPZQ5YKZt-Ooxc2HK4lfUcURCJ6mzWCw9FgR69ai4QtXdxYP1SqJYy8IMGWk4Oue8SkMyXlCHnk4lyNJGa2BGH20n6nLzduCk8rhNGSaEYzUmfxMLuX4F-UwbmldvvAt6eAiQxT1W2i-Cgt0XON5DgF9UmjVx52iQuDT51rmjSDZHsifb9WIqSdeWyIsu_Vchh ) retrocomputing.stackexchange.com Why doesn't this older thing work perfectly with a newer thing that didn't exist when the older thing was created? subject: Meet Ola.cv: HackerNoon Company of The Week
text: Meet Ola.cv: HackerNoon Company of The Week Learn How You Can Share Your Story on HackerNoon Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ <[URL] Heyo Hacker ğŸ’š Welcome back to another edition of HackerNoonâ€™s <[URL] Company of the Week! This series aims to give tech companies from <[URL] our database the big bright spotlight they rightfully deserve. This week, we are proud to present <[URL] Ola.cv <[URL] , the official registry for the .CV domain. If youâ€™re wondering why â€œ.cvâ€ sounds familiar, thatâ€™s because itâ€™s the short hand for curriculum vitae, or that piece of paper you submit when applying for jobs. Curriculum vitae tech is either non-existent, or hopelessly outdated, but thanks to services like Ola.cv you (or your brand) can build next-gen professional links and profiles, joining industry leaders who are using .cv domains to build their digital presence. <[URL] <[URL] Want to be featured on HackerNoonâ€™s Company of the Week? Request Your Tech Company Page on HackerNoon! Fun Fact: Ola.cv Takes The Awkwardness Out Of Using Your Own Name as a Domain If you have ever tried to <[URL] buy your first name <[URL] <[URL] as a domain, you already know the punchline. Almost everything is taken. Michael.com. Sara.io. David.dev. Jane.xyz. Gone. Sold years ago. If you want one today, you are either bidding at an auction or wiring four to six figures to a domain investor. It is not surprising. First names are not unique. There are thousands of people who share yours, and the earliest buyers locked up the inventory long before you had a chance. There is now one exception. Ola.cvâ€™s new global domain extension, .cv, is offering first-name domains at a price that would have been unthinkable anywhere else. The extension calls itself the internetâ€™s home for professional identity, and it is giving people the chance to claim FirstName.cv for a lot less than elsewhere. For most people, this is the first time in a decade that a first name domain has been available without a multi-thousand-dollar auction attached to it. <[URL] Why does this window exist? .cv launched globally last year. Its earliest breakout moment came from its adoption by read.cv, the designer and developer platform later acquired by Perplexity. That exposure pushed .cv into the global tech audience. But because the extension is still young, first names have not yet been mass registered. In other words, the land grab has not happened yet. You are early. How to secure your first name? The easiest way is through <[URL] Ola.cv, the official registry storefront. You can search for your name, buy it instantly, and get full DNS management in the dashboard. For most people, the premium first name price comes out to $100 today. Once the discount ends, this will likely return to the standard premium tier. <[URL] Want a profile in sixty seconds instead of building a site? If you want your FirstName.cv to become a fully generated professional profile without design work or writing, you can skip straight to <[URL] Hello.cv. It creates an AI-crafted, Notion-style webpage that is optimized for ChatGPT, Perplexity, Gemini, and other answer engines. You get a clean professional profile, Structured data built for AI indexing, A page that shows up fast for â€œwho is <your name>â€ queries, Zero configuration, and free .cv DNS Management If you want the AI experience, go to Hello.cv. If you want the raw domain and none of the AI-powered stuff, visit <[URL] Ola.cv Folks, take note! <[URL] Share Your Company's Story via HackerNoon Ola.cv ğŸ¤ HackerNoon Business Blogging Ola.cv has partnered with HackerNoon on the <[URL] business blogging program, designed to drive technologists to content and optimize brand recall. HackerNoon's Business Blogging program gives the business the screen space of the author bio, links to business social media accounts, and a prominent call to action linking to anywhere on the interwebs of the sponsor's choosing. For Ola.cv, the business blogging program offered an opportunity to bring their best foot forward, and truly demonstrate their technical prowess to a relevant audience. Discover Ola.cvâ€™s Latest Insights on HackerNoon: â–ªï¸ <[URL] Free .cv Domains for Everyone: A Tiny Island Nation Is Rewriting the Future of Professional Profiles â–ªï¸ <[URL] How To Get a First Name Domain for Less Than $101 <[URL] Ola.cv ğŸ¤ HackerNoon Targeted Ads + Newsletter Campaign Ola.cv also partnered with HackerNoon to promote its â€œClaim your name on a .cv domainâ€ campaign via the <[URL] HackerNoon Newsletter. This partnership put Ola.cvâ€™s â€œClaim your name on a .cv domainâ€ messaging in front of 325k+ tech professionals and enthusiasts who follow the HackerNoon Newsletter, targeting the most relevant technology categories on HackerNoon to maximize effectiveness. <[URL] Ad Placement by Content Relevancy, Explained in 7 Seconds â–«ï¸ <[URL] 50,000+ tech tags across <[URL] AI, <[URL] Web3, <[URL] Programming, <[URL] Startups, <[URL] Cybersecurity, <[URL] Finance & more. â–«ï¸Smart targeting: every story gets 8 tags + a parent category. â–«ï¸ <[URL] Multi-format ads: banners, logos, newsletter, and audio. â–«ï¸3x more clicks than elsewhere. â–«ï¸Leads at unbeatable prices: CPM ~$7, CPC ~$5. <[URL] Learn How You Can Advertise to Your Specific Niche on HackerNoon That's all this week, folks! text: Can ChatGPT Outperform the Market? Week 21 Top Tech Content sent at Noon! <[URL] AWS 10,000 AIdeas Competition <[URL] <[URL] Read this email in your browser How are you, @hacker? ğŸª Whatâ€™s happening in tech today, December 25, 2025? The <[URL] HackerNoon Newsletter brings the HackerNoon <[URL] homepage straight to your inbox. <[URL] On this day,NASA Launched The James Webb Space Telescope in 2021, Gorbachev Resignd and Ukraine left the Soviet Union in 1855 AD, Huygens Probe Landed on Titan's Surface in 2004, and we present you with these top quality stories. From <[URL] From Lagos to Mauritius: We Paid People to Play Mario Kart with Bitcoin to <[URL] Best Shopify Scaler APIs 2026: The Definitive Deep-Dive for High-Growth Commerce, letâ€™s dive right in. <[URL] The Market Today #1 <[URL] <[URL] Bitcoin$87702.73 +0.76% <[URL] web3 <[URL] From Lagos to Mauritius: We Paid People to Play Mario Kart with Bitcoin TL;DR Mario Kart at the second edition of BTrusts Dev Day held in Mauritius. <[URL] By <[URL] @tobses [ 4 Min read ] Picture this: a room full of developers, business owners, Bitcoin enthusiast etc. at a conference in Mauritius. The usual networking vibes gets overshadowed by Mario Kart music and people yelling at a screen. In my years with Bitcoin, I've seen different use cases. But gaming? That was new... <[URL] Read More <[URL] machine-learning <[URL] Hedgehogs vs. Porcupines: In Defense of â€˜Spikyâ€™ Writing in the Age of AI TL;DR Are you a hedgehog writer or a porcupine writer? Read this article to learn why spiky writing is important in an AI-driven world. <[URL] By <[URL] @harveyk42 [ 10 Min read ] A few weeks ago, back when <[URL] ChatGPT 5.1 was released, one â€œVery Important AI Manâ€ <[URL] joked about the em dash and the ability to take it away from the model due to â€œoveruse.â€ Thatâ€™s the whole problem. On the page, are you a hedgehog or a porcupine?.. <[URL] Read More <[URL] business <[URL] Best Shopify Scaler APIs 2026: The Definitive Deep-Dive for High-Growth Commerce TL;DR The definitive 2026 guide to Shopify scaler APIs. Lomit Patel breaks down the Catalog API, Functions, Prediko AI, and Agentic Commerce for high-growth brands. <[URL] By <[URL] @lomitpatel [ 5 Min read ] The "Unicorn Era" was defined by growth-at-all-costs. The 2026 Era is defined by Lean AI and Agentic Commerce. In this guide, I will deconstruct the core APIs that allow brands to scale from $10M to $500M without bloating their headcounts or slowing down their site speed. The Request Payload:.. <[URL] Read More <[URL] programming <[URL] Javaâ€™s Greatest Hits (of Failure): Top 10 Open-Source Errors of 2025 TL;DR PVS-Studioâ€™s year-end roundup of the top 10 strangest Java errors found in open-source projects in 2025. <[URL] By <[URL] @akiradoko [ 18 Min read ] This year, we checked many open-source projects and wrote <[URL] articles about them. Well, it's time~ Let's go! We open our top with a case from <[URL] LanguageTool. In a way, the project resonates with us: just like PVS-Studio, it analyzes languagesâ€”only natural ones, not artificial. The PVS-Studio warning:.. <[URL] Read More <[URL] machine-learning <[URL] Can ChatGPT Outperform the Market? Week 21 TL;DR I did not create a post for 21, so this is for continuity. Sorry! <[URL] By <[URL] @nathanbsmith729 [ 6 Min read ] <[URL] Read More <[URL] On This Day <[URL] NASA Launched The James Webb Space Telescope <[URL] The James Webb Space Telescope, launched by NASA on December 25, 2021, is a next-generation space observatory designed to study the universe's early galaxies, stars, and planetary systems. It is the largest and most complex space telescope ever built and is equipped with a 6.5-meter primary mirror, four scientific instruments,... <[URL] Poll Of the Week <[URL] How do you want your AI to sound when it talks to you? OpenAI has introduced new controls that let users adjust how ChatGPT sounds, including its warmth and enthusiasm. The change follows concerns that overly expressive AI can encourage emotional reliance or blur the line between tool and companion. By letting users choose the tone themselves, OpenAI aims to give people more control over how AI communicates with them. <[URL] Friendly <[URL] Neutral <[URL] Professional <[URL] Expressive <[URL] Don't care about tone. Just be accurate ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» What happened in your world this week? subject: Issue 309: Your year Stacked
text: Issue 309: Your year Stacked AWS re:Invent, coding with cats, and mayo disasters ************* The Overflow. ************* 24 December Don't let all those year in-review posts on your social media feeds fool youâ€”we've got plenty of new stories for you this week. We just got back from AWS re:Invent, and we've got the skinny on all the new tech announced. Two podcasts, two different takes. First, our very own CEO Prashanth Chandrasekar and Director of Data Science Michael Foree joined us to discuss everything they heard and saw at the event. Corey Quinn, Chief Cloud Economist at Duckbill and snark king, also sat down with us to debrief on all things re:Invent, from the new technology to the restaurants. If you're more of a reader than a listener, we have a full recap for you on the blog of everything you'd want to know from re:Invent 2025. Fine, we won't be a Scrooge McDuck...we'll get into the wrapped spirit too. Let's take a walk down memory laneâ€”maybe with Your 2025 Stacked, our fun year-in-review for our Stack Internal customers. Not your style? No worries. From the web, we've got a state of AI coding report for you, so you can look back and think about all the hours you saved (or more likely wasted) with coding bots. If you want to take it even further back, read about how they're recovering the lost files of Sega Channel. Maybe you'd even be interested in the history of your favorite default font, Times New Roman. If that's too much nostalgia for you, let's wrap this up by bringing you back to 2025. No Overflow could be complete without a few questions and a few answers, and this week we've even got the top ten Q&As of the year from our sites. Plus, we've plenty moreâ€”everything from melting big pieces of ice to ritualized workplace confessions and mayo disasters. It's all down below for you, wrapped and ready to go. ------------- From the blog ------------- Last week in AWS re:Invent with Corey Quinn ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/cDRlC_N23X0MUBSb8yugcuWOBniWkkssbR8QyjOqq3Gfw_EF8iMYVWiNmYv2Sp0ZKccksRyJYxADs8sr8TMFXJzyLDUloUEoFxG07YR8NxQ29fDIgemFAnMLQWYy5gGR6v_ah33poM7aa17LDON5A2xynfvYYWAP2gkOWzJxtyfFWqLDofZF3NE_u1KkIMhUfgUz7f8VEMw-BX-QOSeb8ivwIOIauiMJW9am-ebic0kW8RGn6hwEX4ULZQO5TF-nux1sZH_6l6k5xvch47sRiD87Y683PhBw3tzAWxkjF9bUZTTqTWYqnoIeeIwHQHrO ) stackoverflow.blog Ryan sits down with Corey Quinn, Chief Cloud Economist at Duckbill, at AWS re:Invent to get Coreyâ€™s patented snarky take on all the happenings from the conference. The 2025 Stack Overflow and Stack Exchange wrapâ€”our top ten questions of the year! ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/fskHk6vHR-un9thl2kPJ75FYEjlPkg_fQN85eGxuFbtDcJ4kXjvXQir_SP4S2EEyxT9vBhF2cydPBMN1LgVODSIEblYdeuCDHvmk6WENWJ9XWO_K7uj-FJYeoX5WbZS5fjEHUsZwPJwNpgSdicSpWviYCdJRL6q8Vj9GXTp_xDfwY7U8wpWSXsSNTZQDvmBE_KRNiy2fWc0tJCxL_YDncV1YL9wiomzW5oVqm6ifrRAj7JhsibL476m-kR3Ks7LxTv97dfAlRVxHE9ikcAA0qgDOgC2Km6b_ojE5bckXZRT1gSz4o3V0BrneSBC-vxv0 ) stackoverflow.blog As 2025 comes to a close, we're sharing some of the top questions from across our entire Stack Exchange Network. Your 2025 Stacked: A year of knowledge, community, and impact ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/E4wadUsHd2BEGr1pi6yfl3Vk-PlMAckcp97vBA8Pc4Pd8BSTc7mEvMUp_AGu7cnLYV-Zjgdd9hvMrXBnS4k4BwiqvpNBjxLMgfbLNgMmjYn0qcQwQd4sAHQBgz8hnfAKh0zSqFa3vo6H0OCnnPT60MkyZQbWXpRq_pzXFumC5DepZs16g39PrJq9p5RYTcSjM2fEYqomcNnlYWf13xt4wuTgl7DvuK9RrbK7Hdjb1n3Th8rQZPMwlkTYuttdp6_U0EFY2gUBpM1lKx8o3pzMsZYjbMsT1zqwqWZwoL3aAjatPVH7Dw-p9F7QeCv72HnUNq6ESqMXN_2xmKWxWRa79w~~ ) stackoverflow.blog From tough questions to standout answers, your team built a lot in 2025. Your 2025 Stacked brings those contributions together in one shareable snapshotâ€”celebrating the people, posts, and topics that defined your year in Stack Internal. Live from re:Inventâ€¦itâ€™s Stack Overflow! ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/J2G40k-57pMrV_RJ0n9w3RG1IPBBDSy5b_savkH3Q6LQE1wW4ZLATLYXOb7ss2WRgCu9TUQE7Xr-lJioYtTADz8lL8-J6WCU9BLTllVyaREJpDPFraHRe-ROV6Emwsk-Ix9SrBtZOb_X8xm9mrtZFApQttpgfxjjYerg9Y81e_V4p6wCwzsRqkMZbL9s3f6V0MVHmKXIIZfxUjByf7V1EGh9Jpg9y2napmV9-01iXh1ZHT7NYQzUtnvmTcbux7l3igAvsnP6zIb8XWYdDfqAf3RFxCDKm92QZpEgVpIGCww~ ) stackoverflow.blog Ryan is joined by Stack Overflowâ€™s CEO Prashanth Chandrasekar and Director of Data Science Michael Foree on the floor at re:Invent to discuss all theyâ€™ve seen and heard at the event, from the future of AI agents to the trust issues the enterprise has around AI and the impact of AI and robotics on the job market. At AWS re:Invent, the news was agents, but the focus was developers ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/m5XkE8gxuJv0P1FzJNOgXsbbEJlRaeXFnoQMbT_WT2rk58vmiKG7VqrGUqGkACvrAH6gkPOLw9FLJARVMzvN-IYOly9sfvGM6X5RCS8lHSS4WBJjJd6nhCiB9NGcZSpIbcN2RWk18iEeL9gWdDKTdbJOeEggCfgHa2CCU2cKJNNkb4Td_iDvKdylzQUIZ6PHmte98jlcjQFSRzkr7ol-LireF5BVAf476aSjGOG1mE4vOekX-LmhznjxwK-nsKwEfGYMjjIMX4tFaWQdJJqa-ptRRGIQkWlnVGKHKTQ-cwt9yLP_dLKjK2DuCgb8kTLLYbzWRZZJPfwjbS-ssh4lSA~~ ) stackoverflow.blog Four days, 60,000 developers, and AI-generated perfume. The re:Invent that was. AI that knows your codebase, starts with Jira ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/oV1WoAn5UNa36a8GaTM0igT2PBU0MMxOpYfu18Kl5jqiSNCv5JBiE618waKEaExgsRE6RWL8Ce1WVY_wVIleQRnN_lib8BhyeJ0xXZvv52n3SCJpgzj5L63Ui_3pgj-SK72F-aF-vTTXo7OFXcCrtw~~ ) promotion Automate busywork with the new AI-powered Jira. Prioritize issues, surface code insights, and review changes right from the CLI or IDE so you can move faster with fewer interruptions. Now thatâ€™s a team changer. Check out the new AI-powered Jira. --------------------- Interesting questions --------------------- Does it take longer to melt one big piece of ice or many small pieces of ice? ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/GPunn5BdQw-FFpKa7dkGHTovFZdXuKLwPz64MfR2YOdBfWA525DX4Bhlxi-uQXi--Z-5G-zOmU6Qg4-v4jCOuJGRLLVaeS-YzYllBHf0rUx-ojLz70gqBaw0X0tt4NktIc3tkIQvCEzrSILdbvBavgEjqNsJ_SwdyHLf8ILS-b8g7lflwxX91If5wznUMdcf7hewP04ys3xStTr81lcL43nCBW71ZxNJjWeA1eUE4r9O9Rcg9Dxz96PnAIjfR3gTMF20IMwHErC9tQINJ2jX7a0pWXKUdwJgUFeHkYdm80AxbIEVesgAE9WYALG7YGTsh8y0h3ei8D8nx6vmbO_NJKAUVb1XAg9CQzFFctLLS-A~ ) physics.stackexchange.com Your ice is only as cold as the thermos you put it in. Managing a paralyzing backlog of â€œpotentially usefulâ€ math papers to read ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/24ApM70fGVZq-gujOAjTZS1v0p7kjkr7tsF_ijlHzVTqGjPU7H_CYNcAIgAC1QcpTsJ-1GSec_dOKM3Vs4FqZQC_x1PMVhP3oPai3A5luJzaCafK_RaQUNQGiPbclBEBBzr9rmAekDk2ZiySXMAbLNioMuYt2pZBfwJp7TrF-EYz5iRsrweEmXV6On2FZhvshuAY2Ma_7MkzLqhNbLn8GJp1ak_048V8bNmRhAoNK3VzT4Gjfvyh5xIFWnIIEqB6cGK2VKjmAE-vMtw2gw6XKBm4I999APfXJpa_gadzXg077FO7IEDTS1WyBrJP3vuCq7Jpjb0vdy4LRL8aRKU4VUGZ_W9Cg5ek_D8HBc_0My4~ ) academia.stackexchange.com Do judge a math paper by its cover. Is ritualized confession a sign of a bad culture of failure? ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/mBm7GA98QcCs2f_L4ve-_dvFiGoiqErrOhhuO2e1imh7eTf_8DkcT8U61HdnYd8j0CSmZZT61mIF2PF0MOVIsOOmbyvA3Q3gIf4ep1zibsmww2CYAfIchgjroAk8N9ZxJY8feWCi7xSpAJbkUXRN010xHwg46w2rK1AbtqO1zZ2iyArCFoNRatCLglaoDO0oqMuE2y1BanosVcTKvo6vR-xcOVpCs2A6wsp1wi7jCRQeBwSHo87xaJd3FkVzxnW0WgJRT3yZETbw3TNqreXvyJMZt7T02r7Z0euXDmcrsvzcjH4XSMYEqDQiASW0qIodiah_vAtkt7T2KkJCxNNz3Q~~ ) workplace.stackexchange.com â€œSorry for apologizing so much.â€ Mayonnaise disaster ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/r-5jDbbuJTL2haEeSm79n40WdES38GENtsg5DivQRPzB8kj9E47AJEDvBKBD3TGNJlnl_-MELrb7r_jNScRO9wcu-5JbdHvcrDtMjvqZAH1pmvwiF8YrD-4KYZGyEtuXiZrf3ffN2Bck2WbksylTtGng10buVHka5n-uOT9sufZaesJwqdlCUJOtiYDhCFbfZEt7M95OVGmzNvoWSSe67sfkt3r26lGfbt0-iLs3Y-llP8JwrBRaYbEljLrhWR4vjk_8XqPUKkl6kkf5MLBgiMsEImyVCcWhg_u6ogBZhcc~ ) cooking.stackexchange.com Emulsion: it's more important than you think. ------------------------- Links from around the web ------------------------- The secrets of Sega Channel ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/nadUFFaR1TBUwYaunZ6XCSMxwznLcv1hmNJUkifepZg3adS_n1_PLchf1sugMn6ybrpE9Nmsbi_K-XPawT0sqJK3NLA8clw37eWlATPhNk77-SQZFJ_ORTm0GujbvLukR63_nSp0j73SrJ1w87XFyA~~ ) gamehistory.org Garfield: Caught in the Act has been saved! subject: FASHN Updates â€” November 2025 Recap
text: FASHN Updates â€” November 2025 Recap Introducing Organizations and FASHN AI Assistant Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­Í Â­ [URL] FASHN Updates â€” November 2025 Hi Edip ğŸ‘‹ As the year comes to a close, in November we focused on major updates to the app and our website, along with several smaller improvements. Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s new: ğŸ¤ Organizations Team Collaboration: Work together in the same workspace and share credits across your team under one subscription. Available on all plans: * Basic Plan - 3 seats * Pro Plan - 6 seats * Agency plan - 11 seats Your organization is already created and appears in the bottom-left sidebar under your account name. To change its name or invite team members, click Settings. More information about Organizations â†’ [[URL] ğŸ¤– FASHN AI Assistant Chat with our smart AI assistant to quickly generate content and get directed to the right tools for your needs. The assistant understands natural language and can run supported tools on your behalf, allowing you to generate results directly within the chat. This capability is currently in Beta, and more tools will be added over time. Our goal is to enable a full workflow entirely through the assistant for those who prefer a chat based interface. This upgrade also prepares the assistant for efficient use in our upcoming mobile app. Chat with the FASHN Assistant [[URL] ğŸ†• More New App Features * Multiple Outputs Support: Generate up to 4 images at once when using Product to Model [[URL] Model Create [[URL] Model Swap [[URL] and Edit [[URL] * New â€œâš–ï¸ Balanced 4Kâ€ Resolution Across All Core Tools: A new â€œBalanced 4Kâ€ resolution option is now available in Product to Model [[URL] Model Create [[URL] Model Swap [[URL] and Edit [[URL] It provides higher resolution output while remaining closer in style and realism to Precise 1K. Balanced 4K is designed to bridge the gap between Precise 1K and Creative 4K: * More faithful to the original input than Creative 4K * Higher resolution than Precise 1K * May introduce small composition or detail shifts * Generally more stable than Creative 4K, but not ideal for fine surgical edits * Background Reference in Product to Model: You can now use a Background Reference image in Product to Model to anchor your generations to a specific location or setting. The provided image is used as the backdrop, ensuring consistent environments across campaigns. Generated models now interact naturally with the scene, adapting to lighting, perspective, and physical elements like ledges or furniture to produce realistic, integrated compositions. ğŸ¨ Say Hello to our New Landing Page Weâ€™ve updated our landing page with clearer messaging, refreshed features, and a more comfortable design. Take a look â†’ [[URL] Weâ€™ll continue smoothing out the app experience through the end of the year and into 2026. Stay tuned. API Updates * New API Endpoint: Edit The Edit tool from the app is now available as an API endpoint. Edit is a versatile post processing method that preserves identity and product fidelity while executing freeform instructions. It can be used to adjust poses or viewpoints for additional angles, apply styling such as accessories or lighting, or correct issues from outputs generated with Product to Model or Model Swap. API reference: [URL] [[URL] âœ… Thatâ€™s a wrap for November! ğŸ‘‰ Try our updates now [[URL] in your FASHN account As always, thank you for choosing FASHN AI as your fashion creative hub, and we wish you a happy holiday season. ğŸ…ğŸâ˜ƒï¸ â€” The FASHN Team ğŸ„ Latest Reads ğŸ“š * How We Upgraded Our App to Support Organizations [[URL] In this article, we break down how we added support for organizations with minimal downtime. We walk through the key technical decisions, phased rollout strategies, and safeguards that allowed us to ship a major infrastructure change without disrupting existing users. * Create Cozy, On-Brand Holiday Visuals in Minutes with FASHN AI Turn plain product photos into festive, on-brand holiday visuals with FASHN AI. From cozy family scenes to matching Christmas sweaters, you can create warm, professional campaign imagery in minutes. * How AI Can Help Fashion Brands Prepare for Black Friday Ads Even if youâ€™re late to the Black Friday prep, FASHN AI helps you create high-quality ad visuals fast. Turn existing product shots into lifestyle images or short videos, test variations, and launch campaigns that look planned months in advance. Join our Discord server to share your creations with us! Join FASHN Discord [[URL] For any further inquiries, please contact us at [EMAIL] [URL] [URL] [URL] [URL] [URL] You are receiving this email because you opted-in to receive updates from FASHN FASHN, 71-75 Shelton Street, Covent Garden London, UK, WC2H 9JQ Unsubscribe [[URL]

This event is considered a major milestone in aviation and the history of transportation technology. <[URL] Poll Of the Week <[URL] What Do You Think About Disneyâ€™s $1B Deal Letting OpenAIâ€™s Sora Use Disney Characters For AI-Generated Video? This collaboration allows for the official creation of AI-generated video content using Disney IP, blending traditional animation history with the future of generative AI. <[URL] Exciting creative future - This unlocks huge potential for fans and small creators to tell new kinds of stories with Disney characters <[URL] Undermines human artists â€“ This accelerates a shift away from human animators, writers, and VFX workers, devaluing the craft and livelihoods that built Disney in the first place <[URL] Dangerous precedent for IP & labor - It normalizes big studios using AI with legacy IP while creative unions and independent artists fight for basic creative protections <[URL] Cautious optimism - The idea is promising, but everything depends on strict guardrails: clear labeling of AI content, fair artist compensation, and meaningful content moderation ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’» What happened in your world this week? subject: Meet ScyllaDB: HackerNoon Company of The Week
text: Meet ScyllaDB: HackerNoon Company of The Week Learn How You Can Share Your Story on HackerNoon Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ <[URL] Heyo Hacker ğŸ’š Welcome back to another edition of HackerNoonâ€™s <[URL] Company of the Week! This series aims to give tech companies from <[URL] our database the big bright spotlight they rightfully deserve. Now, let's talk about this week's feature... Ever used Discord, ordered Starbucks through your phone, or browsed Zillow for your dream home? There's a good chance <[URL] ScyllaDB <[URL] <[URL] was working behind the scenes. This week's pick is a monstrously fast and scalable NoSQL database that's built differently - literally. With a shard-per-core architecture that delivers predictable single-digit millisecond latencies at millions of operations per second, ScyllaDB helps companies power data-intensive applications at massive scale with lower costs and better performance. You can grab it as open source, enterprise software, or a fully-managed cloud service. <[URL] <[URL] Want to be featured on HackerNoonâ€™s Company of the Week? Request Your Tech Company Page on HackerNoon! Meet ScyllaDB: Fun Facts From Hypervisor Hackers to Database Disruptors ScyllaDB's origin story is rooted in deep systems expertise. The company was founded in 2012 by Avi Kivity and Dor Laor, the brilliant minds behind the KVM hypervisor - you know, that technology that basically powers most of today's cloud infrastructure. They initially set out to build OSv, a revolutionary cloud-based operating system, and were having great success improving database performance along the way. But then they hit a wall with Apache Cassandra. No matter what they tried, they couldn't push it past a certain performance ceiling due to fundamental architectural limitations. So what did they do? They made the bold (some might say crazy) decision to rebuild the entire thing from scratch in C++. The result? A database that can handle 1 million transactions per second on a single server. Not too shabby for a "let's start over" moment. Curious about the vision behind ScyllaDB? <[URL] HackerNoon interviewed founder and <[URL] CEO Dor Laor last yearâ€”it's worth a read. <[URL] The Discord Migration That Made Headlines One of ScyllaDB's most famous success stories is Discord's migration of trillions of messages from Cassandra to ScyllaDB. And we're not talking about a small app here - Discord has over 350 million users who collectively send an astronomical number of messages every day, and ScyllaDB handles all of it. Here's the heartwarming part: CEO Dor Laor mentioned in a recent interview that he has a special soft spot for the Discord deployment because "my son was very excited and proud about this." Even database CEOs get proud parent moments when their tech powers their kids' favorite apps. <[URL] Monster Scale in Real Numbers When ScyllaDB says they handle "monster scale," they're not exaggerating. Check out these real-world deployments: â–ªï¸Palo Alto Networks runs over 10,000 clusters on ScyllaDB (yes, you read that right, ten thousand) â–ªï¸China Mobile operates a mind-boggling 4 petabyte, 180-server workload â–ªï¸Disney+ Hotstar uses ScyllaDB to deliver instant recommendations to hundreds of millions of viewers These aren't just impressive numbers on a spec sheet, they represent the real-time experiences millions of people have every day. Whether it's your morning Starbucks mobile order, your evening Discord gaming session, or binge-watching your favorite show, there's a good chance ScyllaDB is working behind the scenes to make it all feel instant and seamless. <[URL] Share Your Company's Story via HackerNoon ScyllaDB ğŸ¤HackerNoon Business Blogging <[URL] ScyllaDB has published a series of insightful articles on HackerNoon that showcase their technical expertise in high-performance database architecture. Their pieces include deep-dives into NoSQL data modeling, performance debugging with Rust drivers, database migrations, and detailed case studies of how companies like Tripadvisor and Yieldmo leverage ScyllaDB for machine learning feature stores and real-time personalization at massive scale. As of today, ScyllaDB has amounted over 4 months of reading time on their stories. <[URL] Here are their top 3 best performing articles on HackerNoon: â–ªï¸ <[URL] How Tripadvisor Delivers Real-Time Personalization at Scale with ML â–ªï¸ <[URL] 6 Caching Strategies and Their Latency vs. Complexity Tradeoffs â–ªï¸ <[URL] Here's How ShareChat Scaled Their ML Feature Store 1000X Without Scaling the Database Join HackerNoon Business Blogging Like ScyllaDB and 4,000 other brands, your company can benefit from publishing on HackerNoon. Our <[URL] Business Blogging Program helps brands: â–«ï¸Build SEO authority by leveraging HackerNoon's domain strength â–«ï¸Reach a global audience with automatic translation into 12-76 languages â–«ï¸Gain editorial support to refine and polish your content â–«ï¸Achieve multiple permanent placements across HackerNoon and social media â–«ï¸Create audio storytelling with articles converted to audio and distributed via RSS â–«ï¸Establish thought leadership in their industry <[URL] Publish Your First Story with HackerNoon Today That's all this week, folks! Stay Creative, Stay Iconic. The <[URL] HackerNoon Team <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] To unsubscribe from this email, click <[URL] here <[URL]

subject: Choose Your Niche, Own Your Content â€“ and Hear It Straight From Our Past Fellows
text: Choose Your Niche, Own Your Content â€“ and Hear It Straight From Our Past Fellows Get published. Grow your reach. Build long-term success. Join the course now â€” at a discounted rate. Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ <[URL] A Jack of all trades is a master of none @ As a writer, one thing is imminent: those who try to cover everything often end up remembered for nothing. Of course, one can argue that what if they were trying new things, or itâ€™s boring just exclusively and repeatedly to write about one thing again and again and againâ€¦ Here's the twist: a niche isnâ€™t there to cage you; rather, it's your home base. The cybersecurity writer who occasionally explores AI ethics becomes more interesting, not less, because readers trust their judgment on adjacent topics. A clear specialty permits you to wander; without it, every topic shift looks like aimless pivoting. So there comes a time when you just have to put a foot down, pick a corner of the internet, plant your flag, and give your readers a reason to return. <[URL] <[URL] Have you heard about the HackerNoon Blogging Course? Everything you need to know is right here! Choose Your Niche - Standing Out By Standing For Something You know what a niche is - like most people. But most people donâ€™t know what having a niche does. A tight niche does 3 things: ğŸ”¸Signals expertise:Readers and algorithms reward depth over breadth; they trust specialists who solve a clear, repeatable problem. ğŸ”¸Accelerates creativity: Constraints force fresh angles. Develop your perspectives, grow your knowledge, and dissect one new regulation each week rather than recapping tech news in general. ğŸ”¸Builds a magnet audience: People come back when they know what they will get and how it will help them next time. So, how do you choose your niche? ğŸ”¸ Inventory your intersections: Make a habit of ideation - list 10 topics you can discuss for an hour each, then cross-match with 10 problems your ideal reader faces. The overlaps are where passion meets market demand. ğŸ”¸Run the "5-Article Test": Draft five headlines inside one overlap. If ideas flow easily, and you're still curious after the fifth - you have a sustainable lane. ğŸ”¸Stake a POV statement: Do your research and find out one thing most people in your niche often ignore. Pin it, read further into it, and voila - youâ€™ve got something to analyze. Voice follows focus. When you know exactly why you're writing and for whom, word choice, metaphors, and structure start to feel inevitable. And when you do explore new territory? Your established voice travels with you, making even departures feel intentional. This is also the beauty of owning your niche and having your own voice. When you do want to experiment, i.e., test a new format, explore an adjacent field, or share a personal story, you're not starting from zero. Your audience trusts you enough to follow. Ready to take all of the above into action? That's exactly what the six-week <[URL] HackerNoon Blogging Fellowship teaches: from niche-selection worksheets to real-time editorial feedback and SEO distribution playbooks. <[URL] Join the HackerNoon Blogging Course! Happy Writing, Legend! The HackerNoon Team <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] <[URL] To unsubscribe from this email, click <[URL] here <[URL]

subject: HackerNoon and GPTZero Partner to Bring AI Transparency and PreserveWhatâ€™s Human in Tech Publishing
text: HackerNoon and GPTZero Partner to Bring AI Transparency and PreserveWhatâ€™s Human in Tech Publishing AI transparency and human creativity FTW! Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ <[URL] Hackers, assemble! HackerNoon is thrilled to announce its partnership with GPTZero, <[URL] benchmarked as the best AI detector on RAID with 95.7% accuracy. This powerful AI detector will now analyse 5000+ monthly blog post submissions reviewed by the HackerNoon editorial team, and our readers will be able to see AI detection disclosures on published blog posts. With this partnership, GPTZeroâ€™s detector will be integrated into HackerNoonâ€™s <[URL] Editing <[URL] Protocol to evaluate and review all new HackerNoon blogs. Additionally, HackerNoon will also use models developed by GPTZero, such as Model 3.7b, to research and report on AIâ€™s impact on blogging over time. <[URL] Transparency in AI Usage: Why It Matters Transparency in AI usage establishes trust between publishers, contributors, and the community. Readers have a right to know that the content they are consuming is written by a real human or AI. This partnership not only protects the integrity of publishing but also ensures that writers using AI responsibly are recognized for it, while readers gain confidence in the information they consume. Preserve Whatâ€™s Human: Meet GPTZero GPTZero is one of the most accurate and reliable AI detectors trusted by more than 10 million worldwide, including students, educators, writers, and professionals. It identifies text generated by models like ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and Grammarly and highlights AI-written sentences with high precision. Organizations, publishers, and creators use GPTZero to verify authenticity, analyze writing, and bring transparency to digital content. GPTZero is building the verification layer for the internet. The mission of GPTZero? Preserve whatâ€™s human, while having fun. <[URL] <[URL] Join their team to build responsible AI products that matter - view open roles! HackerNoon </> GPTZero: More About Our Integration Hereâ€™s how <[URL] HackerNoon and GPTZero have implemented automated AI detection: â–«ï¸All new submissions will be analyzed using GPTZero. HackerNoon editors review over 5,000 monthly submissions from more than 50,000 independent contributors, checking for AI usage before publication. â–«ï¸GPTZeroâ€™s models will be part of HackerNoonâ€™s Editing Protocol â–«ï¸Readers will now be able to see whether the story is written by a human or assisted by AI, enabling trust in what they read. This partnership supports two critical goals: â–«ï¸Improving transparency and trust in digital publishing and AI usage at scale â–«ï¸Celebrating independent tech writers by acknowledging and preserving human creativity AI transparency and human creativity FTW! <[URL] Stay Creative, Stay Iconic. subject: Issue 307: New season, new agents
text: Issue 307: New season, new agents AI Assist, robotic lobster traps, and stock trading LLMs ************* The Overflow. ************* 10 December When fall turns to winter, it can often seem like everything around you is taking their own subtle shifts. And just like how the weather changes and the leaves start to fall, the world of technology is no different. On the blog, our CEO Prashanth Chandrasekar writes about one of those shifts in technologyâ€”how success is measured in a post Gen-AI world. And in a post Gen-AI world, the shift in technology seems to feel distinctly agentic. Guillaume De Saint Marc from Outshift by Cisco joined us on the pod to talk about the future of multi-agent frameworks and what kind of infrastructure needs to be built for it. Speaking of agent infrastructure, on Leaders of Code, our very own Ben Matthews sat down with Postman's Abhinav Asthana to talk APIs in the AI era. Plus, this week, we're introducing our own agentâ€”AI Assist, a new way to access the 17 years of expert knowledge living on Stack Overflow. Even as the seasons change, some things remain trueâ€”traditional RSS feeds are boring, people love free movies, and code is only as good as the humans who are working on it. We have all three of those stories around the web for you this week, plus one on why finance bros should now fear AI taking their jobs like the rest of us. Oh, and another truth that remains true: robots are pretty cool. We were joined by Viam's VP of Engineering, Simone Kalmakis, to explore how abstraction is making those very cool robots attainable for the everyday person. As the leaves fall and a chill starts to bite your nose, you're probably asking yourself a lot of questions right now like...what model computer appeared in both Star Trek and Serenity? Or maybe the winter air is making you wonder if the word "goodly" is real. Maybe you're even thinking about quitting your job, even if its only been a month. Well, you won't believe the coincidenceâ€”we've got all of those answers for you for you this week. Check them out, and everything else, in the links below. ------------- From the blog ------------- Treating your agents like microservices ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/nRxKvLFHBbz9nVM8T-E-NiNqbWk2v7IKDWFbIP27JaWqFhco3DEjGPsH6GHALu40aOU7FeHE3tPpArYUO6jgTA3YjsBuBQ0wa8eceCQh1Yz0RP2Q46azgNAsFEqngvtbkSTiHwHomLo6Q3ts6buJa-FcBq6HRUwYTAIj6AqFE-CYg45ULIx5tH01sCUkUTe6nuY19yeu_wT8KUK2duvepLvDQsva9ArAaqHZKAsSGNQHzVKSWrSDxaMaXgjBJa_CQQAkMsxGEf7xu29D-NT7Wf2Ks0OIFxOuGayvGhuj5O0~ ) stackoverflow.blog Ryan is joined by Outshift by Ciscoâ€™s VP of Engineering Guillaume De Saint Marc to discuss the future of multi-agent architectures as microservices, the challenges and limitations of the infrastructure for these multi-agent systems, and the importance of communication protocols and interoperability in order to build decentralized and scalable architectures. Postmanâ€™s journey and unlocking the power of APIs ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/vbBMe5zwB7vuIYhwFf9WRm2zbKQQfYUVfqCWHp9tLOYnD8wRzayM9buzlwWtijv2y54zXI_eax81NrQaMF7arAjs2RM-sPA2TB0GCUQ2fjuhsNgyDKLGNG_no4ksC7CICph7BAECMk3GraGkQvuQAXOnsoV4NAQyCuAO4sIgTfWWJBGtn_EVL55mGAQdNVfoRZ1MND5-p5BeeUqWqtz4wSq_JDV8nKc2xp0wmw_nlyrcwnHLx6ZXcUV4R6-hxarDGEzQQFR_St_4iC0HWLL0cxRsDeA65IrQbfCRNH0okemi3ZPZujwOppq5fJJBm-IZ ) stackoverflow.blog Lessons learned building a global API platform, navigating hyper-growth, and API-powered AI agents. Introducing Stack Overflow AI Assistâ€”a tool for the modern developer ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/hovOKzL1pNHOC6MlGz-7E-BG-BkjvsLJF0JVuIKxsGxDZ83P9-W76Fg5nSvxJ_0MbR65MgpTHbnuMkk_ciZILCIoAQXeGJdTryLIWRQX50WmmVnYes6v5LZsUQ0yGnC2d-oAah4rtWNli0A2ItnoMqf68BPmix6cDJlH9aGuhuxymemij4qODrzeMzyjNo5v3rmhr-77BxADcsOL7MNYl1FO2CPO-vx1w5trZ0Ak52ieaul-q0I1s09zDJLXDO_wcAtSKDuoXhljWFjF18GWqXpsKvBwcOfo1x60F2DO91RlQVeg2jk-a2agL5WLvly6gfjnadn6urJ9m33dmpxm7Q~~ ) stackoverflow.blog The way that developers interact with knowledge has changed in the age of AI. That's why we created AI Assistâ€”a new way for users to access our 17 years of expert knowledge, and how Stack Overflow is remaining the always-open-tab of programmers around the world. Disrupting yourself in the age of AI ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/3C0vUbvV7_wdsAEXxJVsQ1gVveS4qm5dHtcRktInc-dYX3GZn2pOu34iWjB4sPgip71um9rvoed6xO6770CQfC1idjx9PerelTzDz8hi8M7vasG-VtEV7AxCWDgFn-hyFkSuvDmkRWl0J_V_ppmxpijfFy1pFSBKpcx5kiIaE1bsLPGsBy-4H60mOMylX3fqzMtzlaK__hRT_dTZsCqLytWEOseV27rtOzCAJa0OHhn820_TVnBwR9HlXPq3wE62csDzV06VhfwgMBURIkVKsnzCwlm5kDRP3z24ok19YL8~ ) stackoverflow.blog The internet is facing a fundamental shiftâ€”and the way we measure success online is shifting too. Reach, trust, attribution, and influence are the new metrics to measure against in the post GenAI era. Abstraction, but for robots ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/r8ed_mti3TCadQwuiGuQRFWKxsWaE6e9tEiRDRjjYokBdhDzvJnEBfaF_S92L79fT9i6ssbtNkufsiZvyBGT3TtqhzpMUsDJPv7d5wCAopBZaDrylCanA1InM2jsWXiUbGaf4bmRHl0B8NRfKK_n9zJarP0JPVHBgIc32HM6p-uuLbMIX0g08zOUVrmhHwNtnHCQRpPLJeOpo5vuOPbxaqAaLMp3tQqt5pKhSu7s8T11_PngDE3FswJnOiP43K3joJvnHulHyLDlaBA7arSHSCO8ew8DG7XAm2bqO3hBMD8~ ) stackoverflow.blog Ryan welcomes Simone Kalmakis, VP of Engineering at Viam, to dive into how her team is bridging the gap between software and robotics, the importance of abstraction layers in making robotics more accessible, and the real-world applications of robotics from lobster traps to industrial sanding robots. AI that knows your codebase, starts with Jira ( [URL]~~/AAQRxRA~/ny9TI7M7KQoZY3xoc3px3ajW6IQ5n4sKlmR3LrbuahXGb45hRhQqMek9Pr1U14Fn1ZF8ym0Y79rH2V7N0xhJE5tMlH5lorYU3j_VP11tD9XDi8mHhpz4x-Nv30s8MEsVmaVZerFs904SFnzHEhT2xA~~ ) promotion Automate busywork with the new AI-powered Jira. subject: Youâ€™re a Business, Man: How Blogging Builds Authority, Opportunity, and Income
text: Youâ€™re a Business, Man: How Blogging Builds Authority, Opportunity, and Income Join the course designed to help writers get published, grow reach, and build long-term success. Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ <[URL] Hello @ If youâ€™re a writer looking to sharpen your skills, grow your audience, and turn passion into career opportunities, HackerNoonâ€™s new <[URL] Blogging Fellowship Course was built for you. We designed it for both beginners and seasoned writers who want to level up - whether that means learning to tell better stories, mastering SEO and self-promotion, or adapting to an internet shaped by artificial intelligence and ever-shifting search algorithms. But before we tell you whatâ€™s inside the course, letâ€™s talk about the one principle that makes it all work: consistency. <[URL] <[URL] Have you heard about the HackerNoon Blogging Course? Everything you need to know is right here! Why Consistent Blogging Is a Cheat Code for Career Growth Think of every blog post you publish as a digital asset. Unlike a meeting, resume tweak, or conference talk, a blog post doesnâ€™t disappear when you log off. It compounds. One strong article can live on search engines for years, silently building your reputation, attracting new readers, and sparking unexpected opportunities. At HackerNoon, weâ€™ve seen this play out countless times. Writers who publish consistently, even just once a week, end up landing consulting gigs, job offers, speaking invitations, and startup collaborations they never expected. Their words become magnets. Hereâ€™s what consistency unlocks: ğŸ”¸Build Unshakeable Authority: Quality articles demonstrate your expertise better than any resume. Colleagues, managers, and industry leaders will recognize your deep thinking and technical insight. ğŸ”¸Create Serendipitous Opportunities: Your published work becomes a magnet for unexpected opportunities - speaking gigs, consulting offers, job opportunities, and collaborations you never saw coming. ğŸ”¸Expand Your Professional Network: Connect with 4M+ monthly readers including hiring managers, startup founders, and tech leaders who actively engage with quality technical content. ğŸ”¸You're a Business, Man:A startup would never not have a blog. Your career is a startup business, blog it seriously. The Blogging Fellowship: Turning Consistency Into Results If youâ€™re serious about writing, this course gives you the tools and structure to make consistency stickâ€”and to make sure your writing works as hard as you do. Hereâ€™s what youâ€™ll get inside: ğŸ”¸Self-Paced Learning: Learn at your own speed with lifetime access to all course materials. Start today, finish when you're ready. ğŸ”¸Proven Exercises: The same writing exercises and strategies that grew HackerNoon into a 4M+ reader platform. Battle-tested and refined. ğŸ”¸8+ Hours of Original Video Tutorials: High-quality video content walking you through every lesson on blogging in tech, from our team of experts. ğŸ”¸Online Community Access: Join thousands of tech bloggers sharing wins, getting feedback, and supporting each other's growth. ğŸ”¸Amazing Curriculum: 8 comprehensive modules covering everything from writing fundamentals to AI optimization and scaling your influence in tech. ğŸ”¸Real-World Application:Every lesson includes practical assignments that build your actual blog and online presence as you learn. Show Your Work: The Graduate Certificate Upon completion, youâ€™ll receive the official HackerNoon Blogging Fellowship Graduate Certificate, recognizing your expertise in technical writing and content strategy. Add it to your LinkedIn, portfolio, or resume to signal credibility to employers, clients, and collaborators. Ready to Treat Your Career Like a Startup? Sign up for the <[URL] HackerNoon Blogging Fellowship Course todayand let your words start working for you. And in case you need a little extra motivation, check out this short clip from former students whoâ€™ve already leveled up their writing and careers through the program. <[URL] Join the HackerNoon Blogging Course! text: Meet MacPaw: HackerNoon Company of The Week Learn How You Can Share Your Story on HackerNoon Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ Í â€Œ ï»¿ <[URL] Heyo Hacker ğŸ’š Welcome back to another edition of HackerNoonâ€™s <[URL] Company of the Week! This series aims to give tech companies from <[URL] our database the big bright spotlight they rightfully deserve. This week, we are proud to present <[URL] MacPaw - a Ukrainian software development company that has been crafting thoughtfully designed tools for Mac users since 2008. <[URL] <[URL] Want to be featured on HackerNoonâ€™s Company of the Week? Request Your Tech Company Page on HackerNoon! Meet Social Meet Catchpoint: Fun Facts From Dorm Room to Global Success MacPaw's story began in 2008 when 21-year-old Oleksandr Kosovan, an engineering student at Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, created the first version of CleanMyMac in his dorm room. What started as a simple utility to declutter and optimize Mac devices has since grown into a comprehensive software ecosystem trusted by millions. Today, MacPaw serves over 30 million users worldwide, with an impressive statistic that speaks volumes: <[URL] one in every five Mac users has at least one MacPaw app installed. The company has grown from that single student project to a team of nearly 500 professionals spread across offices in Kyiv, Ukraine, and Boston, USA. <[URL] Resilience Through Crisis MacPaw's journey has been marked by extraordinary resilience. Despite the ongoing war in Ukraine following Russia's 2022 invasion, the company has maintained operations with over 70% of team members remaining in Ukraine. As CEO Oleksandr Kosovan stated: "In times of crisis and external chaos, I believe businesses exist largely for their people, providing something solid to depend on. Our true resilience is shown not only through fighting in the war, but the ability to keep business operating and fulfilling promises to customers and partners." MacPaw shares not just technical insights on HackerNoon, but also perspectives on maintaining innovation under extraordinary circumstances. <[URL] Share Your Company's Story via HackerNoon MacPaw ğŸ¤HackerNoon Business Blogging <[URL] MacPaw has partnered with HackerNoon through our <[URL] Business Blogging Program, sharing deep technical insights and cybersecurity research with the tech community. Their latest blog post, <[URL] Your Employees Want Macs, Your IT Team Needs Them, argues that overreliance on Windows exposes IT systems to massive risk. Macs, with stronger security, longer lifespan, and seamless ecosystem integration, offer lower total ownership costs and higher employee satisfaction. The message to IT leaders: adopting Macs isnâ€™t a luxuryâ€”itâ€™s a strategic upgrade. <[URL] Join HackerNoon Business Blogging Like MacPaw and 4,000 other brands, your company can benefit from publishing on HackerNoon.
